text: Thai food is just delicious but Panna Thai makes it irresistible.   Food is scrumptious with good portions.   Ambiance is very private, mellow yet warm & friendly.   Prices are very reasonable (almost like Thai BBQ).  Overall ~ will be coming back for more!

If you're in the mood for good thai food, stop by. They  have a great Tom Yum Chicken soup, and my daughter loves the skewers. My favorite is the beef salad xtra spicy. The staff is VERY friendly and you get served rather quickly. They even deliver if you do not feel like going out.. This is our favorite place after soccer practice. I highly encourage you to give em a try

I really love this place.  I think the food is better than any of my other Thai food places...problem is it is far from me...probably a good thing because I would go there all of the time!  I think there dishes are very well done, tasty and to the point.  Servers are all very gracious and conscientious.  A nice place to go when you have a craving for Thai food!

I was there a few days ago with a group of mostly asian friends, myself i would have never chosen to go here because I hate spicy food. The restaurant was very cute , nice atmosphere, the servers were efficien,but  to me the food was boring ( I guess because I had requested my food to be the least spicy as possible), however everyone in my group loved everything they had....

After a long weekend in Vegas, we ordered take out from here and brought it to my friend's house.  The BBQ ribs were perfectly seasoned and tender. The wonton soup we had was chalk full of veggies.  Our only knock was the calamari - by the time we got home - wasn't crispy anymore.  Otherwise, it was fast, tasty and we will visit again.

I am a big fan of Thai food and Panna has the best Thai I food in Vegas (I think its even better than Lotus of Siam (which I thought was good but not great).   I had their tom yum soup which was delicious.   The restaurant itself has a great ambiance and it looks very clean.  The service is also great.
Delish! Coconut soup medium and garlic short ribs at least 1x/week! They are great for take-out and dining in. Always friendly - always good!

One of my favorite places to go for Thai food. Their menu is huge! I love their crispy duck and summer rolls. The prices are reasonable and everything that I have tried so far was delicious. I also love that you can order online and then just go pick it up. A definite must try!

I don't review much, but since we eat here a lot and we're crazy about their Crispy Soft Shell Crab, the Seared Scallops, Yum Tuna, Minced Chicken & Shrimp with Curry and Crispy Duck Salad, (among other dishes), I felt it was time to say something nice. The dishes are original and super delicious, with no added MSG, and the service is exceptional. Every meal we've had has been off the charts good.  My wife and I used to eat at a lot of different Thai restaurants, in search for the best in town. And although it's a bit of a drive for me and there are dozens of other Thai restaurants closer to home (some pretty good), we can't eat anywhere else anymore.
Best Thai food around the southwest area. The satay beef or chicken is to died for. Also, larb with sticky rice is my all time fav.

This is the worst thai restaurant I've ever been! we were there today for lunch and ordered lunch special , which is the mango chicken and it comes with a vegetable soup. I should say it was a mistake of mine not to pay attention from the very start, i thought it was a big piece of napa cabbage in my soup,  i did not really care about it, just sipping the hot soup and at the end, i found out that it wasn't  a napa cabbage but a big piece of TISSUE!I called the waiter and showed him whats in my soup, and his response was did you drop your tissue!!??????he thinks that I am a scammer trying to have a free lunch!!!!!##@#@@#@he does not seem to be apologetic and said i will come back and when he  returned he asked me, would you like another soup??#$@##@# The mango chicken was a disgrace. Please people, save your money and don't even try this restaurant at all! there are other much better Thais Restaurant in Vegas.!

Easily best Thai food in Vegas. We had the bang bang shrimp (perfectly spicy), the duck noodle soup (wonderful tender meat), and the massaman curry (stewed beef is amazing). I've eaten their pad Thai and several other dishes and I LOVE all of it!

Someone referred this place to me while I was in Vegas this trip so I had to try it. I was not disappointed! It was so good and so fresh! I had the ahi tuna salad (good amount of tuna, good amount of dressing, good to split between 4 people if you plan on sharing all your food selections) and sa te meal with beef (perfect flavor and perfectly tender, peanut sauce was perfect, egg fried rice was tasty). Other people in my party ordered the fish cake and red chicken curry. Didn't try the fish cake but they said it was good and I wasn't too fond of the curry personally but it may be be caused I'm biased towards the homemade one my grandma makes. Anyway, this place is must try for Thai food in Vegas!

Wow. Really mixed reviews on this place,so I decided to check it out for myself. My wife was craving something spicy,so Thai seemed the perfect choice.  We ordered some pad Thai noodles with shrimp and a plate of medium spice curry with chicken.
The chicken pad thai was soooo good, with a side of sticky rice!! Def will go back to this place. Live 2min from this place

My friend and I went there and the staff was quite welcoming ... We went there during the weekday in the evening after a long day of work. The place was clean, well decorated and thier presentation of the food was nice. Thing i didn't like was ... the wait on the food was a bit long. My friend brough her daughter so of course the little one was getting a bit ancy ... after the wait ... the food wasn't that bad ... i enjoy their salads!
This is a nice place on that side of town. I really enjoy the atmosphere with high ceilings and a quiet ambiance. Try the desert - it's great.
I alway order delivery. This place is awesome. The food is always hot and fresh. I haven't had anything yet that I don't like. I definitely recommend this restaurant. Staff is always friendly.
Horrible horrible horrible service. We sat for 10 minutes and were not greeted so we got up to leave and all they did was wave us goodbye

Nice little shop, decent decor and ambiance. Yellow curry was creamy and tasty, one of the few places I have been too where you get more chicken than potatoes. Rib soup is tangy and tasty. Basil chicken is decent, pad Thai a little on the sweet side but still palatable. Giant glass of Thai ice tea. We will be back.

It's not too often I'm in this area of town, but when my nerdy husband wanted to make a stop at Maximum Comics one night I figured it was a good time to try a new restaurant.  So we made the stop at Panna Thai for dinner.  The interior is beautiful and would make a great date spot.  Great art on the walls, comfortable seating, an overall lovely atmosphere for enjoying your dinner.  I started with the veggie soup after being told that it was ok for vegetarians.  It was good- a light soup full of veggies- but I have the sinking suspicion that it wasn't veg-friendly.  Well, on to the next...  We had the summer rolls as an appetizer and I really enjoyed them.  Lots of veggies packed into the roll and the peanut sauce helped round the out the dish.  This might have been my favorite thing we ordered.  For our dinner, we ordered yellow curry tofu, tofu basil noodles, and the asparagus with shitake mushrooms.  The yellow curry was good but a little bland and really only consisted of giant chunks of tofu with a few potatoes.  I still enjoyed it- I just thought it could have used a little more oomph.    We asked our waitress which noodle dish she recommended and she suggested the basil noodles.  This dish was really good and I'm a big fan of Thai basil.  However, I think it could be a great dish if there were more noodles to match the amount of tofu and veggies.    I'm not quite sure what I was thinking ordering the asparagus since I'm not too fond of shitake mushrooms...  I guess I was just assuming there wouldn't be a lot of them on the plate.  Well there were a lot but I did my best to be a big girl and eat them.  The asparagus and mushrooms were fresh and this dish had a lot of flavor, but it was another thing I had that left me questioning if it was vegetarian or not.  Overall, I think this is a nice spot for dinner.  The atmosphere was great and our waitress was very attentive and friendly.  Some of the dishes needed a little love (and please more rice!) but I still enjoyed my time here.  I don't think I'd make the trip from North Las Vegas just for the restaurant, but if I were in the area would come back again.  Heads up to vegetarians, they say they can leave the fish sauce out of what you order (whether you believe a restaurant or not is up to you).  Don't forget your coupon from restaurant.com!
Had a great meal, bang bang shrimp was our fav. Date night ended with fried bananas and coconut sticky rice ice cream. Yum!

This used to be my favorite restaurant but I am little reluctant to go back now. My friend was craving for thai food and I recommended to go this place.We had Tom yum soup , beef salad and Choo Chee soft shell crab. Tom yom soup, we added shrimp, tasted little salter than usual. beef salad , it was good but there was too much dressing which made the salad very salty. Finally Choo Chee soft shell crab came, it was fired soft shell crab with coconut curry and very very salty!! The curry on top was so salty that I felt like I was eating curry concentrate and my tongue was feeling numb from trying to eat  that stuff. I am not sure if they changed their chef, but food has been inconsistent from last few visits

I hate giving bad reviews to small businesses,  especially restaurants.   But this place consistently has the worst service I've experienced.   Have been several times but the most recent experience is what now leads me to say something.   The wait staff is horrible.   I walked in to place a to go order.  It was not busy at all.   No one at the host stand.   I looked at the menu (which i grabbed myself) and when ready to place order,  was waiting forever for one of the staff to take my order.  No one came over.   I finally just walked out and drove over to nearby Thai restaurant.    I've dined in a few times as well and the service is just as bad then too.  I hope they see this review and make some changes.  I'm sure I'm not the only one to have experienced this.
Love, love, love this place! Its my to go thai joint. Food is yummy and service is an A+. Lunch prices are such a good deal and good sized portions. One of my fave's!

Completely rude and terrible staff. Food is way overpriced for the amount that you get. I'd probably smile if I drove by and saw this place went out of business. Never spending another red cent with these complete idiots!!

My friend and I went to this restaurant on a Tuesday night. The ambience was very nice. We ordered the Pad See-ew with beef, Sweety Duck, yellow curry with pork, and coconut ice-cream. My favorite is the sweety duck, although it's a little fatty, but very delicious. the other dishes were tasty as well. We really liked their home-made coconut ice-cream. It has coconut shave and mango chunks in it, very creamy and coconutty. They also take the gift certificate from restaurant.com.

Though their food is flavorful, it is not fresh.  I was there 2 weeks ago and ordered a pad thai with shrimp and they served me rotten shrimp.  The manager was gracious and offered to change my dish but I felt sick after eating rotten shrimp so I wasn't up for another dish at that point.  They took the dish off my bill so there was no issue there.   I went back to the restaurant thinking if I don't order shrimp I would be good. Boy was I wrong, instead of rotten shrimp, they served me a young coconut that was not so young.  The coconut turned pink on the outside as well as the inside and the juice tastes bitter.  I didn't say anything as the waitress was giving dirty looks like I shouldn't have come back.  They served me rotten shrimp and had the audacity to give me dirty looks like it was my fault.  Needless to say, I won't be back.

FREE refills on the thai tea!!!!! They have a lunch special everyday I believe. Between 11-3! I always get the Ginger Ginger Ginger dish! Also comes with a light vegetable soup, small eggroll, and a salad (salad is just shredded lettuce...no dressing or anything!!!!!)

Having lived in this area for almost 3 years & just now discovered this amazing Thai restaurant wants me to make me slap my forehead! Why do I keep on going to Thai BBQ all these years, ugh! I love Panna Thai! This is now my only & favorite Thai go to place. Restaurant is so clean & fresh, wait staff are so welcoming, attentive & friendly, big portions of food, very nice (food) presentation that they always served hot  & refillable thai iced tea! Woot-woot!!! I have seen Thai BBQ food & service quality go down the drain. One time, I got served with re-cooked chicken that looked & tasted nasty. They even get stingy with the thai iced tea refill so I stopped going there & with YELP's help - I discovered this place. My whole family eat here twice a week. Hopefully, they will try to excel more & keep everything consistent.
Delicious food; lovely, fast service; pretty decor; ice cold Singha!  I love Thai food and this is the best I've had in all my trips to Las Vegas. Will certainly return!

I ordered the beef salad meet was chewy the crab in the crab fried rice was imitation and clearly not fresh also rice has chunks of something hard in it prob shell from the can crab, now let's rewind the ordering process was very hard the lady could barley understand me not from her lack of English but because of her talking in the background to other staff she said it was busy out when I came yo pick up my order it was only a small birthday party needless to say I'm NEVER going back

The fried rice was nothing special. The vegetable garden is sloppy like they just used the left over vegetables from every other dish and the crab wontons were the worse disappointment. The fried shell was soggy and the filling didn't have that wonderful cream cheese flavor they usually have. I don't think I can even give this place another chance. Such an unsatisfactory meal.

The dishes here are the closest I've seen so far to the original Thai food flavors. Lots of well seasoned flavorful food. Many of the options available on the menu are not present in other Thai restaurants in town. The service is very good. Our waitress made a small mistake on our order, but immediately apologized and gave us a complimentary dessert to compensate for that, which was nice and very professional.  Will recommend this place as the best Thai in town so far.

I love this place because not only does it have amazing authentic thai cuisine but it's not some hole in the wall with dirty bathrooms and horrible customer service. Which is all I seem to find when looking for a Thai food restaurant. The prices are fair and during the season they have delicious  sticky rice with mango. So worth the drive from the north side of town of which I live.

I LOVE SPICY FOOD.....They have the best BEEF SALAD and the CHICKEN YELLOW CURRY I ever tasted in Thai Restaurants... Awesome place...I work in the same plaza, so we order there all the time for lunch... I'm always leave happy when I order from there...=)

Placed a delivery order, called the restaurant 10 mins after I placed it to switch something minor. She told me my order had already been picked up and on the way. 45 mins later my order showed up not fixed (we live 10 mins away). We usually eat here once a week and this will be our last due to terrible customer service.

This is my absolute favorite place to go every Sunday. People will ask me what Im doing for lunch and my response, "I've got a date with Panna." Seriously though, customer service is absolutely great. Last time I was there, the lady had forgotten I had said no onions and was utterly apologetic for it, which was unnecessary as accidents do happen, but then proceeded to extend the hospitality by bringing out a dessert as an apology. I mean, even though it was unnecessary and very generous, you just dont get customer service like that anymore.  Oh and fellas, this little restaurant is hiding some of the most beautiful women I have seen in the desert to date.    Enjoy, XO

I have had delivery from them around 10 times and they are perfect every time. I'm originally from San Francisco with the best Thai restaurants is the U.S., so I'm very picky about Thai food. They are always so nice and everything I order from them is spot on. This is my favorite restaurant in the Southwest. Good clean food.
Very friendly staff and amazing food, I've enjoyed their chicken satay like 3 times and I will be going back for more!!! I work in the same shopping center so it's awesome to have them as an option

I usually like this place. I put an order in online and it didn't go through so I called at 6pm and they said 20 min.  50+ min after ordering our order comes through the door, they sent it out for delivery. We asked for a new order, they checked it for temp and said it still felt hot. It wasn't good when it got home. Be honest with your customers... we'd be more patient and understanding.

We bumped into this place on a date night when we were going to play mini golf next door, and what a pleasant suprise. The food staff and service were amazing. We ordered a bottle of reisling which complimented our dishes very well. The food did take a little longer than expected but it was worth the wait. We will be back for seconds...and thirds...and so on
Really yummy I would have the calamari and the the soup was delicious. The music is very relaxing and the bathrooms are really clean.  Also love the mango salad.

We went to Panna last week. We had dinner and ordered some take out. I love all of their food. The restaurant is clean, awesome owner and staff. I'm so glad my house is only 5 minutes away from this place. Yummy yummy yummy happy tummy!!!!
BEST THAI PLACE I HAVE TRIED SO FAR.... amazing service from are server apple just great food most difficultly I will come back

The only reason I am giving 4 stars it's because they are extremely understaffed. The waiters and waitresses work extremely hard and were very polite despite of the circumstances. Customers kept coming for take out and dine in and they lost some business as people walked out and cancelled their orders. I feel bad for the workers but they have great service and the food is delicious!

I went here tonight for the first time because I had a restaurant.com certificate and was feeling like the comfort food goodness that is Thai cuisine.  When I walked in, the atmosphere was pleasant and quiet and the server was friendly.  I ordered the egg rolls, the tom yum goong, the pad see ew, and the red curry.  Everything was really tasty.  While it wasn't THE best Thai food I've ever had, it was easily one of the best places I've been to outside of China Town (though this place is sort of on the cusp).  My only (minor) complaint is that they didn't have the type of egg rolls I liked.  Definitely worth visiting if you're in the area.

I love Thai food. This place is one of my fav Thai restaurant in town. The people are always friendly. They have a more modern decoration with a touch of Asia, very soothing. We love the curry fried rice and the panang beef. The egg rolls were good not great, Pad kee maow was delicious (even though I've had better). They put good servings on your plate. Overall they have good food at a decent price.
The staff is very friendly and attentive. The chicken larb is one of the best larb dishes I've had in town. Pad see ew was good as well. Refillable thai tea is a nice bonus. I'll definitely return.

Traveled here for dinner with a group of friends.  Restaurant has a nice, upscale interior.  Service was prompt and relatively attentive.  The table ordered chicken pad thai, chicken and beef sate, chicken panang curry and pork larb.  Although I did not taste it personally, the pad thai was described as "okay".  The pork larb was pretty tasty, although the requested "thai hot" it was not.  Sate was above average, with the beef outshining the chicken.  The panang curry was unremarkable.  Overall, a pleasant enough experience, but there are many other Thai restaurants that I would recommend ahead of Panna Thai.

This IS our local neighborhood Thai restaurant.  We've been coming here since they opened years ago.  I'm surprised I didn't write a review as soon as I opened my yelp account. The summer rolls with peanut sauce are a great way to get your veggies in without thinking you're eating too healthy.  My favorite dish was the Thom Kha Ga soup, but now the Golden Cups appetizer takes that spot. The service is good & the food is prepared fresh and fairly quickly.  The atmosphere is great for a family gathering or meeting of friends. They are also great for take out. The best thing about this place is that they are willing to modify dishes to meet my husband's dietary restrictions due to allergies. Not many places will do that williningly.

Stopped here on my last visit to Vegas and was very satisfied. The food is delicious and the customer service excellent. You can order anything from typical Thai dishes to original creations, and can't go wrong. We had a large group so I was able to sample a lot of it, and loved it all.   Try the ribs for sure. The scallop appetizer is great, as well as the fried spring rolls with mango salsa. And don't forget to order their fried banana with coconut ice cream! It's not the typical fried banana dish. They chop it up and roll them into coconut covered balls, and the ice cream is something special too.  Overall a highly recommended place.

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE SERVICE!  The only reason I decided to eat here was because I received a special coupon from Restaurant.com -- it was not a coupon I purchased but a promotion Walgreens was running and I got a $25.00 gift certificate. During my lunch break, I met my boyfriend here and immediately saw an unprofessional sign which said they are no longer accepting the Restaurant.com coupon. I was instantly disappointed and I spoke to the waittress and said I had no idea it was no longer accepted and no where on the certificate does it say management may refuse to accept. Her manager cut in and told me she was no longer accepting the coupon. I said I didn't realize that but is there anything you can honor? She replied in a snooty attitude that she can't accept the coupon and it is not her fault and I can receive my money back from Restaurant.com. I told her I didn't purchase the coupon and so there's no money to be redeemed except for at this restaurant. I asked for her manager and she said the owner was not working today and I asked for his card so I can email him and she said she wasn't allowed to give out his contact information. I asked when he would be in so I can ask him about the coupon and she said he doesn't come in everyday and she has no idea when he'll be here. Throughout the whole time she was be very rude and pointing in my face and I told her that because of her lack of resourcefulness and inability to be polite, I could not eat here so she right away told me she can give me a coupon for $15 and I decided to take it and order some food. However, the coupon was $15 off a purchase of $50 and my boyfriend and I could not order enough food to equal $50. The food was good but I have had better thai food with definitely better service. I will not be returning here.

When I first get into this restaurant, I like the way they design the set up and it looks very nice for the atmosphere as a whole. And the server greeted us very friendly. There is no doubt that the service is excellent in this restaurant. It is a restaurant that truly cares about the guest's satisfaction. And at the end, the boss gave us two tasty fried banana balls as a gift for our first time trying in this restaurant. Yummy yummy

If you are in the area, stop by for lunch or dinner.  The food and service is surprisingly good.  There is always room for improvement, but they are still new - so, keep an open mind.  The restaurant is very nicely decorated - modern, clean with authentic Thai touches.  Check it out.  Also, they are open to your suggestions.  Asked to speak to the owners if they are available.  I had their lunch special, Stir-Fried Basil and Chili with Ground Pork.  It was good.  Also, I had their Thai Beef Jerky - that too was good.  I look forward to visiting them again and trying their other specialty dishes.

So far I've tried the ginger fish which is amazballs! Pad Thai, can't ever go wrong with that. BBQ spare ribs was good but nothing too special. Drunken noodles was kind of like pad Thai but a bit spicer. Spicy crab noodles was good. When I'm in the mood for Thai food I'll def will be back.

Customer service is terrible. Walked out of the restaurant after being sat at a table, and no one taking our food or drink order for 10 mins. The employees themselves were all sitting at another table talking to each other, barely making any eye contact at all. We were the only people in the restaurant.
Their dishes are delicious and they give you a good amount of serving. They give you refills on Thai Tea as well.  Panna Thai also have a great crew.

I've been to this restaurant 3 times recently with my boyfriend. I've had the chicken pad thai each time; he's had the curry chicken and cashew chicken. We've both enjoyed everything we've had there.   The restaurant has always been rather quiet, which makes it a pleasant place for conversation, and is pleasantly decorated.   Not 5 stars because the service is a bit slow and the spiciness levels seem to vary drastically ("medium' has meant both "just a hint of spiciness" and "so spicy it burns."  Overall, a solid restaurant and one that I'll probably return to regularly.

Had dinner with the family here on Friday night. Have to say I was impressed. We had a restaurant.com certificate so ordered a few dishes. Had the Thai egg-rolls, which were delicious. Lighter and flakier than a Chinese egg-roll. Had the calamari appetizer and it was really good. Little salty but I like salty, plus the sweet chili sauce with it was yum.   For dinner we had the Pad See Ew, Green Curry, and the Asparagus vegetable stir fry with Tofu. All 3 were amazing, especially the asparagus and tofu, it had shitake mushrooms in a brown sauce, that was just a great combo.   Now Pad See Ew and Green Curry are a staple for me when I eat Thai, so I can use them to compare other places and I have to say this is one of the best places in town. Beats Archies hands down for sure. Proportions were big leaving plenty of left overs.   To top it off it was really nice inside the place. Subtle lighting with dark woods and stone work, make for an excellent atmosphere. Could definitely bring a date here to impress at a cheap price.

My friends and I went here last week.  They seemed really slow. Out of the group of 6, I received my food last for some reason. After reasonable times for appetizers, they served 2 people their meals, after a few minutes another person, then another few minutes 2 more people... then after a LONG time, they came out with my food.  I'm not a vegetarian or anything, but after eating In-N-Out all week, I decided to eat a "healthy" meal. So I ordered broccoli mushroom with tofu. That could be why my food took a long time. I found it odd since most places try to serve a group's meal within a few minutes of each other.  The food wasn't too impressive.

Got to try this spot out over the weekend, and I am bewildered WHY we didn't try it sooner!  We have been going to Benjaroong since it was so close to our house.  However after trying Panna Thai we have officially met satisfaction.  Not only are the prices great, but the flavors were amazing and FRESH!
Really great Thai food. High quality ingredients.

Very impressed by not only the food but the vegan options! Ordered the pineapple curry with fried tofu, no fish sauce added vegetables and the yellow curry which were both very flavorful and delicious! We also got the first actually good pad Thai since going vegan that didn't end up showing up with egg and fish sauce in it! Everything was very delicious and extremely pleased our order came at the established time and exactly how we ordered it! Will definitely only be ordering from this Thai place from now on!

I've been here a number of times for both lunch and dinner.  The prices are very reasonable.  The food is good and is a good value.  The service staff is very friendly and I have found this a good place to take kids, at least kids that know how to behave in public.
Great food. Good atmosphere.   I got the yellow curry with chicken and it was great. Lots of chicken.

This is me and my wife's go to place.  We love this place and order out all the time.  We get everything from the soups to the beef salads to Pad Thai, garlic short ribs.  The service for us is always great and the food is always good, we have never had an issue there and we've been going for at least the last 5 or 6 years since we discovered it.  Highly recommend.  They have great and affordable lunch special as well.

Surprised this place has 4 stars! The food wasn't terrible but being next door to such amazing Thai places that set the bar so high (Surangs & Corner Thai), you've got a lot to live up to. We got   Pork Pad Thai- spice level 4 no complaints here, was good !  Papaya salad - spice level 4 but papaya was really soggy with the sauce and wasn't sliced the authentic way, which really changes the texture.  Vietnamese egg rolls - the neon orange sauce was way too sweet, no spice at all. Not home made  Sticky rice - even though it's only a $2 item it's what I look forward to almost the most. This seemed to be really old. The second we took it out of the bag it hardened up and was inedible. ;(

THE BEST THAI FOOD EVER......... Wife brought me here I never thought I would love it some much if it wasn't so far from home I would eat here every day. Their ribs are AMAZING and there spicy chicken chowmain is the BOMB.

I think without Panna and their lunch specials -- awesome food if I may add, half of the nurses at work would starve. Just saying. :D  So thank you Panna for delivering your delicious, inexpensive, and convenient food to us!

its ok.  visited on a tuesday night.  had the chicken fried rice... chicken dry.  egg rolls were good with the right amount of spice but the rest of the family's meal which was a bit of everything was all in all nothing different or unique than any Thai take out joints.  just ok.  service just ok.  price average.  lets just say not memorable.

I am so glad I decided to try a new Thai place after going down the street for 2 years. I wanted to find something that was better than "just ok" and dare I hope for even friendly service? Well I found that at Panna Thai and I not only highly recommend it but will return. Most amazing Garlic Beef, which has been hard to find out here in Vegas. I used to live in Thai Town L/A for quite a few years so it's really hard to impress me when it comes to Thai Cuisine. This place not only has great food, but what really stood out was the friendly waitress/cashier. She was running around doing everything herself and never broke stride, all with a fantastic attitude. The place was clean, comfortable and you know it's a good sign when you walk in and the place is filled with patrons native to the food's country of origin :)
As always, food was great and on time! Pad Thai and sweet basil are always a must. And their Thai iced coffee too!

Amazing place, good ambience, Best Thai place around this area. So many items to choose from, their lunch special BBQ Ribs is amazing...their crab fries rice is delicious, they serve fast, awesome service. Would recommend this restaurant any day.

We visited this place to day for the first time.  We were really expecting to like this place based on all the reviews we have seen, but we were very disappointed. The place has a nice interior and were greeted immediately and seated.  No one explained the menu, but we asked many questions.  We ordered the lunch special of Pad Thai, salad, soup and egg rolls.  Items came out rather quickly.  The soup first and it was probably the most tasty thing we had.  The main orders came next and they had forgotten my egg roll, but they showed up with them in just a minute or so after advising them.  They stuck an extra in there for the mistake.  The egg rolls were fairly tasty.  Our main entrees however were basically bland, no spice, no taste at all.  I could tell I was chewing something, but you really could not tell what. My wife also agreed that it was tasteless.

Like using Ketchup on spaghetti.  After much consideration, and a coin flip, we decided on coming to Panna Thai for dinner last night.  The interior was clean and inviting.  I loved the giant golden elephant paintings on the wall and their Christmas tree made me feel all warm and fuzzy inside.    The service was fine as well.  The food is what deems Panna a 2 star joint.  We ordered the fried calamari and the pad thai with tofu.  Fried Calamari - Large rings of calamari were a bit tough and quite dry.  The breading had an interesting flavor that wasn't offensive, just not something I was eager to eat.  It was served on a plate of shredded lettuce, but much of the breading fell off, creating a swamp like pile of dusty breading, very unpleasing to the eye.  Pad Thai w/ tofu - The Pad Thai here uses a tamarind sauce, which tasted like Gochujang (Korean red pepper paste) and not much else.  This was like boiling spaghetti noodles, adding ketchup and calling it Italian.  The sauce was heavy, and slumped on my palate long after dinner.  Panna falls short of being good Americanized Thai food.  I prefer the authentic flavors found at other restaurants (where's the kaffir lime leaves, fish sauce, galanga, etc...??)   Bottom Line: Panna Thai is clean and inviting with good service, but the food leaves a lot to be desired.

First time writing a review. Here goes nothing.. I ended up ordering the Pad See-Ew (Medium Spiciness) and my friends ordered the Sweet N Sour Beef, Choo-Chee Shrimp (Hot spiciness) and Calamari for starters with a couple Thai Iced Teas. It was pretty slow in there so we got our food pretty quick. The Choo-Chee shrimp was really spicy. I would not recommend the Sweet N Sour BEEF, Stick with PORK! Pad See-Ew was a little on the sweeter side even when I ordered medium spiciness. Calamari was one of the highlights though, it just melted in your mouth and the breading was perfect on it. Overall, The inside of the restaurant was very clean and the service was great! With all that food it came out to $50, which is a little on the high side but well worth it.   Until next time.. Stay Hungry!

This restaurant is has been my thai food craving go too. My husband and I enjoy their lunch specials. They have a big variety of creative appetizers as well. The thai tea is unlimited (seriously? Amazing) I have yet to try the thai coffee but I will next time! So far my favorite dishes are; soft shell crab, yellow and green curry, my husbands fave is noodle that has real crabmeat but I forget the name. I looooove ordering their fresh young coconut juice served straight from the coconut. All of their fried rice is really good. This place is clean with good service. Authentic thai food. I'm glad this place is close to home :)
I go here often with my family, usually on sundays after church. Service and food is always great every time we go. Never had a bad experience. One of my fav thai places!
I love this place! I always get the chicken fried rice or chicken skewers. Very quick and delicious!

Not your typical Thai Restaurant. We tried the Bang Bang Shrimp and the Scallops for dinner and they were amazing. The shrimp was in a curry sauce. For my entree, I had the yellow curry with Scallops. I was actually pretty amazing by the quality of Scallops. They were not the small ones, they were the bigger - good quality ones. It was a bit spicy but it was perfect and complimented the side of rice that came with our order. I also tried their skewers and they were also really good. The place is really clean and modern unlike a lot of Thai places that I've been to. I honestly thought that this was just going to be "another Thai restaurant" but it definitely went beyond my expectations. Try this if you're craving for good and authentic Thai food.
Absolutely amazing. I am definitely give 10 stars if I can.. Everything sooooo delicious. Fun dining experience..  will definitely go back again and again.

Picked up food to go for an evening in.  When I arrived, the food was ready and warm.  The Yellow Curry is by far the best I've had in Las Vegas.  The beef Sa-te is also delicious.  I'll have to come back to try out their other dishes and service!

We're waiting 15mins for the table,but inside have a lot table was empty?we order water with lemon,but no lemon,soup is too sour and put a lot cream,taste notgood?high chair was shake?it's not safe for the baby

Panna Thai has a really delicious menu, although we usually end up ordering the same things. Two of the best items are the seared ahi tuna and eggplant/shrimp. The service is good and we never have to wait long. The ambiance is also very modern and pleasant. So why only 2 stars? Unfortunately, last time that we ate here, my girlfriend paid for the bill with her credit card and left a generous cash tip. The staff then decided to take an additional tip from her credit card. This is straight-up theft. Unauthorized charges on an individual's credit card is a crime. Furthermore, it shows that the staff is not communicating. We still may go back for the food, but we will definitely be paying our entire bill in cash.
Ordered phad thai (extra spicy)/shrimp & spider crab/coconut curry. It was soooo delicious n tasty.  Shrimps on phad thai were huge and spicy was perfect.  Wish give us little bit bigger portions.

A good Thai place that is open on Sundays! I ordered take out and my food was ready exactly when they said it would be. Although I did not dine in, i did check out the dining room and it seemed very clean. The staff was very friendly and quick. I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai lunch special it was about $8, this pad thai was made with a little bit of thicker noodle than I have normally had on Pad Thai. It could have had a little more flavor for my taste, but it was still really good. It comes with an egg roll, and a small salad. I had a thai iced tea as well which was PERFECT! I really liked this place! I will definitely come back again and try some of their curry.

The food was delicious, the staff was accommodating and friendly, and when our waitress wrapped our food -- portions are large and we couldn't finish -- she slipped an order of saté in.  Icing on the cake, free refills on the Thai iced tea.  We will definitely be returning!

Will never go back to this place again.  My mother and I used to love this place. We would go all the time. We just went today for the first time in months and i don't know if they changed owners because it is not the same.  The waiters and waitresses are so slow!! The food is not as good as it used to be. The ice has a very bad taste to it.  We went with my 4, all under the age of 9, nieces. When they brought the bill we were all ready surprised because the bill was so high. We checked the bill and saw that they already charged us 20%tip!!!! We asked the waiter why and he said cause it's 4 people or more. That is so ridiculous I have never heard of that!!! Especially charging for children.  Which makes perfect sense why we had such bad service.  Will never go back.

Every single time I have eaten here, I have only ordered the Beef Salad & the Monster (Shrimp Salad) every time!  I'm addicted to the sauce & the vegetables in the salad are fresh!  The fried tofu is the only appetizer I get cause it to comes w/ an amazing & addicting sauce.    One day I may or may not ever try something new cause for me, it's just that type of restaurant.  I love these two salads... strange, but a must-try!  Especially if you want to eat alil healthy.!

Good price lunch specials with nice matching portions, ordered the yellow curry, pad Thai, and beef with basil.  Delivery took a bit of time but I assume that as average for southwest area. Around 30-40 minutes. But when they arrived super nice and food was nicely packed and hot.  Beef and basil was very flavorful and that was my favorite out of all three.   Pad Thai was decent, it was good but wish it had better noodles or maybe a richer sauce. But it's by no means bad at all.  Yellow curry I have had better and wish that it was less watery a bit more flavor lacked a lot of spice and the curry wasn't very thick.  Overall, I enjoyed their food and would order again. Great that they deliver!!
Don't waste your money unless you like food like Panda Express. The satay chicken was hard and plastic like. You get what you pay for. Lesson learned
Great Customer Service. Fast. Inexpensive. Delicious. Clean. Did I mention the customer service!

A great place to go to. Stopped here for dinner by chance as I was passing by and tried beef/curry and it was delicious. The portions size are large enough to fill me, price is decent. I can't comment on delivery or anything but in terms of dining in it is worth trying.

So this is the 2nd time we have been here and I have to write how great our experience was this time!! Our waitress was apple she showed great hospitality and really made us feel welcome. Great part about it was that she used to work at arawan one of our favorite places before so we remembered each other. Ok so onto the food. Me and the wife started off our appetizers with the divine scallops man was it good!! Very well harmonized taste. It was a little spicy with an herbal Thai kind of taste to it. But wow we really enjoyed ourselves!! We also had the steamed dumplings mmm it was delicious. I thought it would have just been a basic dumpling taste but boy was I wrong it had so many delicious taste to it. So onto our entrees my wife got the seafood eggplant. The seafood eggplant was such a well portioned delicious meal. Came with eggplant, shrimp, fish, squid, muscles, bell peppers, & onions. I got the bbq spare ribs. Bbq spare ribs was fall off the bone good! Literally the meat was so tender!! Overall my experience has made me very happy with our dinner tonight. So please come here it's great and such a chill place to eat at!!

I have ordered pretty much everything on the menu and it has all been delicious!  I do get sad when they run out of the mango sticky rice though, it is my addiction.  The restaurant is clean and the staff is very polite and accommodating.  The presentation of their food is nicely plated, even when I order for delivery.  You can't go wrong with the spare ribs, larb, pad thai, and mango sticky rice!

Delicious food, great dining experience.  One of the better in the southwest!  I frequent the many Thai establishments in this area...and there are several.  Of the choices around, I give this place top marks.  Even before I look at the menu, Panna merits high marks for a great dining room and customer service.  The food is always good and they put a little extra into presentation.  Not that I care much about that at Thai restaurants if the food is good, but it's a nice change.    This is a good spot for a business lunch, or if you fancy Thai on a social outing but are looking for a little bit more upscale setting.

Great restaurant! Nice and clean inside with AMAZING food and customer service. I had the yellow curry... amazing. My husband had the pad Thai, amazing. A couple starters both amazing and the desert was just too goood. Would recommend to anyone! Must try! And again the customer service was great, huge plus on top of the food being great!

Probably the best Thai restaurant I've been to. Been here a few times & nothing has changed.  Interior is exquisite, classy ambiance, super clean, friendly servers, good relaxing music & most importantly, delicious food!  My favorites are Yellow Curry, Chicken Sa-Te, Garlic Short Ribs, Pepper Steak & of course, Pad Thai!  The best part? THAI TEA is fresh, authentic & REFILLABLE. I know, I know. It's crazy. They were even so nice to pour me a to-go Thai Tea for the road.  I LOVE PANNA THAI!

I was in town for the weekend and got invited to a birthday celebration there. There were about 20 of us and yet the service was excellent! We ordered a plethora of appetizers and dishes as well as various drinks and honestly nothing was left out.  What was really shocking was that they gave out free refills for the Thai iced teas! We asked if this was complimentary but they informed us that they usually only do it for regular customers like us. Talk about getting on their good side!  Overall this was a great place to go for both food and service, the restaurant itself was very clean and tidy and even had a flat screen tv so we could watch the NBA finals. How did we end the night? Fried coconut covered bananas. YUM :D

My first time ordering delivery from Panna Thai was exceptional! My sister and I ordered Thai Beef Jerky, Summer Rolls, Papaya Salad, and the Pineapple Fried Rice. I was shocked that even with take-out, our food was presented beautifully. As far as the taste, everything was phenomenal.   I am half Laotian, so I grew up eating the same cuisine and this has blown me away with both taste and service. It stays true to authenticity yet remains unique with a modern flavor profile. Definitely will be a return customer!

My family and I have been coming here for years. We usually order take out but when we do dine in the service is always great. Our favorites are the Tom-Kha soup, the Asparagus, Chili Cashew and all the curries.

I took the family here for lunch today since we were in the area. I normally eat Thai once a week (at least) and I'm pretty picky Thai eater. I have my favorite Thai restaurant in town (Lucki Thai) but I decided to give Panna Thai a try. Let me tell you that we were glad we did since the food and service were excellent!! We had Beef Sa-Te (Satay), Chicken Tom Kha, Thai beef salad, and sweet basil chili chicken. I like spicy so they made it extra spicy for me and the sweet basil dish was outstanding!! Rich sauce and bold flavors and best of all, they used fresh red Thai chilies! Enough to say that It was spicy enough!! The soup was great as well, one of the best we have had in town and/or out of state. Our server (Apple) was cordial, attentive, and checked on us throughout the meal. We got to try also their fried banana dessert (on the house!) and it was delicious! I would definitely make the drive again to enjoy other dishes from their menu. I highly recommend this place to anybody looking for affordable, yet high quality Thai food. Can't wait to go again!!

Used to love this place. This time I ordered delivery and I'm a vegetarian. I get pineapple in place of meat and they charged extra??? So ridiculous. Then the delivery girl shows up with no chopsticks. The meal had a pretty strong plastic flavor. And I FOUND CHICKEN in my vegetarian entree. A small piece of really old chicken. So gross I had to throw it away. Makes me wonder how sanitary their kitchen is if old meat is laying around. I would call to complain but they wouldn't understand me  hard time just taking the order.

Since we moved to this area almost 2 mos ago, every place we try here seems to be amazing! Honestly, Panna Thai might be the best Thai food that I have ever had! I lived in LA and San Fran as well, so I know my Asian cuisine! :) And they participate in the Yelp Order Online feature?!?!? I am so happy to live less than 1 mi from this restaurant n other tasty spots!!!!

I work at the salon next to Panni Thai so I have had them for lunch for myself and for catering lunch for the salon many times. They have delious food (love the Thai pepper steak!) and the golden cup appetizer.   They are very sweet and always take great care of us! I highly suggest giving this place a shot, you will be very happy you did!

I love Panna. We order take out from here at least 2-3 times a week. Great price for the quality, always consistent. Good service too, I recommend the half chicken half beef satay dinner. You won't be disappointed.

The BF regularly orders from here when he's at work. I get leftovers when he overorders- which isn't all that often, actually. The thai jerky and the crab fried rice are consistently good options, but I especially like combining the two. The dipping sauce for the jerky is awesome! They do have a $20 minimum for delivery.

Terrible place for Thai food all frozen our Appetizers we're cold we sent them back 2nd the Shrimp  pad Thai was cold and shrimp tasted fishy we decided to pass on them remaking our original  Appetizers the server insisted that they'll be better even after we told her we'd pass on it we were ok with just the chicken satee but she brought them back out  told us the chef made them all over again we didn't want to argue with the server so we said fine snd again tasted freezer burnt dry nasty bland We just wanted the check she kept asking if we wanted desert we replied No. Thank you just the check ! Very irritating  once again we Won't be back The whole experience was so bad from the beginning when the server kept coming back every 2 seconds we hadn't even looked through the menu we'd let her know 3 different times that alone should of been the first sign to the end !

Unfortunately it did not go well. The service was friendly but when I got my take out home I found there was hardly any sauce on the pad se ew so it had no flavor. I had to make my own sauce and add it. Then I was enjoying my fresh spring rolls when I found a bug smashed on the piece of lettuce that was under them. Not very appetizing to say the least. I probably won't be back since both dishes I received had issues.

Ordered through door dash and estimated time of 30 minutes. Placed order and it said an hour - ok. Got a message saying it would be 20 minutes past that. So delivery was completely disappointing. we ordered pad see ew, massaman and fried rice - all level 8. They must have completely ignored that request as everything was zero spice. The three entrees we ordered came with a tiny serving of rice too... normally you get rice per entree. The massaman curry was the most pathetic thing I have ever seen - maybe three pieces of chicken and one potato chunk. All of the to go items were in different packaging and unorganized. So disappointed for the price definitely not worth it !!!

Love this place.. Especially the curries they serve.. I love em all though, from spicy basil chicken to the spicy/ garlic eggplant. Hmm! The best thai food in town. I think.Will recommend. Staff is so Nice and courteous!

I usually don't like or prefer Thai food but I really enjoyed the pepper steak! Cooked perfectly and packed with flavor. It was pretty spicy but to me it was perfect. My family was also happy with their meals. The Thai tea was delicious as well. The best part for me was the service. Our server was super attentive and friendly. Will definitely be back :)!
The best Thai restaurant in Vegas!!! Make sure you order the pad Thai. Friendly service will definitely come back!

We came in at 9:45, they close at 10:00. I know, I know. The last customers...rude They were very welcoming and politely reminded us that they were closing soon. I ordered the Panang, as it's my standard Thai food order. It's how I rank a place. The best Panang I've had in Vegas  so far. Husband ordered basil noodle, which is their rendition of Drunken Noodle, or Pad Ke Mao. His standard Thai order. Best he's had. This is our new Thai Fave.

We have been eating here for years and it's consistently good. The service can be slow during busy hours but the ambiance makes it tolerable. We love the Prig King, Red Curry with fried tofu and the vegan spring roll appetizer is great. Servers are always super nice and they deliver too! Bathrooms are always spotless which we live. Highly recommend this place.

I generally always stick with Pin Kaow 2 as my go-to spot for thai craving in Summerlin....but Panna Thai has given PK2 a run for its money!  This restaurant is very clean and the decor looks brand new. Our waitress was new, a trainee, but she was very pleasant, conscientious, and a lead server or manager was basically over her shoulder the entire time making sure she was on point. Excellent service.  We ordered: -Riesling -Cucumber salad -Summer rolls (non fried) -Chicken pad thai -Masaman curry  The cucumber salad was my favorite of everything, and all of it was delicious. The vegetables were so fresh and the dressing was very light (rice wine vinegar and something else I can't quite put my finger on). I was in crunchy, cucumber heaven.  I will definitely be back to Panna Thai!

My second time visiting here was last night.  Always order my favorite:  Chicken Satay $7.95 - These are HUGE. Feels like you almost get a full chicken breast with every piece and the peanut sauce is good!  Crab Wonton $5.95 - Not something I always order when out eating thai but I did here and they were cooked perfectly. I know they are fairly easy to make but I think everyone's had some pretty horribly cooked (burned, no filling, ect.. I know you're thinking of those bad one's right now) CW's and these are not the case here.  Pad Thai $8.50 - 5 spice & tastes like 5 spice. Comes with sprouts, carrot shreds, lime & peanuts on the side for flavoring as desired.  All three of these are plenty of food for two people (this evening it was me -starving & my preggo buddy & there were leftovers!).  The restaurant itself is beautiful. Large in size compared to most others & with a modern decor. I'd say pretty good choice if you're looking to impress someone & not break the bank here. Not to mention service is awesome.  Overall my favorite Thai place right now with service, price & food added up makes it well worthy of 5 stars.

Tried this place out for dinner tonight thanks to a restaurant.com gift certificate.   Restaurant was clean and spacious. I'm used to the "hole in the wall" settings. This one has a nice laid back interior.   We ordered shrimp pad thai, sweet chili basil with chicken, and crab fried rice. Portion of pad thai was a bit small but the size of shrimp was rather big. Spicy chili basil with chicken was good, but didn't taste anything out of the ordinary.  Same with crab fried rice.  This order was huge.  The latter 2 orders we took home to go since both portions were more than enough for 2 people.  I would come back to this place if I were in the area, but I think I still prefer my usual go-to Thai place Noodle House.
Horrible service. The food is good but with service like pana provide their paying costumers even the best food in the world will taste like s**t. To the grumpy waiter - carma ia a...
Food was delicious and delivery was 15 minutes earlier than original quoted time! Thanks!!
Great lunch menu, everything was reasonably price and well prepared. My wife loves the wonton soup and summer rolls for carry out.

Nice atmosphere, great service & good food. Ordered the chicken curry fettuccine and shrimp panang curry. I felt our meal was just average, didn't really stand out to me. I was pretty disappointed because the curry was like soup! I like mine a little bit thicker consistency so i thought maybe this is just how they make theirs? But the flavor was definitely there. I like that their menu is very presentable and has many of the common Thai dishes i enjoy, that i would like to try next time. Probably pass on the curry. As for the thai tea, i saw on a "tip" for Panna Thai that it is unlimited thai tea and thai coffee..which sold me because no place ever does refill on thai tea. It has been a few yrs since that was posted but they may want to change that. Instead it is limited to 2 refills, still better than none!

This place is great! the atmosphere and decor makes you feel very comfortable. When I first walked in, they greeted me and sat me right away. The waitress was very attentive and outgoing. She tried to spark a conversation as well as made sure our drinks were always full. I was very pleased with the service of this staff.   I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken and was craving rice but did not want to order another entree since I wouldn't be able to finish it. A convenient feature they have on their menu is that you can order a single serving of rice which was what I was craving for! I ordered the egg fried rice single serving. My boyfriend ordered the pepper steak. We both ordered the crab rangoon for a appetizer.  The appetizer came out very shortly after we ordered and tasted very fresh. There wasn't a lot of stuffing in the crab rangoons, which didn't bother us since we ordered so much food. The only thing I thought was weird was they didn't ask for the spice level I wanted for my Pad Thai which came out not spicy at all. I would compare it to a 0 spice level from 1-10 scale. I prefer mine to have some spice but it didn't bother me because I could make it as spicy as I wanted.  The pepper steak came out with a generous amount of steak. We couldn't finish everything! We had plenty of left overs to take home!  They took our dirty plates as well as replace each dirty plate with a clean plate after each entree. I loved that they took that into detail in their customer service/server training because I feel, it makes me feel more catered to. The service made my first time experience here fantastic and I will be back again. I would highly recommend this place!
Hand's down the BEST Chicken Pad Thai I have ever eaten.  Ever.  Clean dining area.  Amazing.
Great close thai place close to home. And they deliver! Can't wait to try again so i can try the papaya fries!

Been there many times and Love this place !!!!   Everytime I go there I will order the panang curry (medium) with beef. The beef is so soft and the panang curry is always good !!!! Medium spicy is not super spicy but still spicy. Good :D  I will also order the Wanton with cream crab meat. It's so good !!!! Last time I went there with my bf's family and we had 2 orders of this. 1 order come with 6 pieces.  Their thai tea has refill which is really good !!!!  Service is good too !!!   can't think of anything to write now since most of the time i just have the panang curry and wanton with cream crab meat lol !!  aww, ok, the interior design and environment are very nice too. And since their food's price are not expensive at all. Why not treat yourself with good food and nice environment?

Got the tofu pad Thai, good and fast service the food was good not something extra ordinary but tasty I asked for spicy but in my standards it wasn't really spicy, I will come back to check the lunch time special next visit
Food and service at this restaurant was excellent! I will definitely be returning here very soon!! One of the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas!!! Hands down

After my perinatal visit I decided I was really hungry. I wasn't sure what I was craving, but I knew this side of town had a vast amount of restaurants that I had been wanting to try. I consulted with Yelp and settled on Thai food.   The restaurant was very spacious and clean and the host was welcoming. There was only one other table occupied as I came in at a weird "limbo" time of about 4pm. I ordered Thai coffee and Basil Noodles with seafood ($13.25) spicy level medium. I gotta say, pregnancy seems to have made me into a wuss when it comes to spicy food. Either that, or subconsciously I was not looking forward to the punishment that is severe heartburn. The portion was extremely generous, I would say enough for two people to share. I had them box up about half of it and had it for dinner little bit later. It may appear pricey to some, but it was an entree big enough to share. My total with tip was a little over $20..so not exactly cheap for one person, but as I said before, the portion and the quality justify the price. They did not skimp on the variety of seafood either.   Their menu has a tapas section with many appetizing options. I am only giving them a four star because I want to try more of their menu before I decide it is emergerd the best thai food eva!  There are enough items on their menu that I still want to try, so I will be back for sure.

Awesome food. The ckn larb gia was fantastic. Nice and spicy. Full of flavor. It came out quick and hot.  The Thai tea was delicious.  The chicken pad thai was a little dry. Their jasmine rice is very fresh. Great atmosphere for a business meeting or an intimate dinner.  Would recommend to anyone

We really don't try fancy Thai food places but this is right up the street and always catches our eyes. We gave it a shot and it was a fancier Thai restaurant. The items were over priced and the garlic spare ribs were hard and didn't have much flavor. The best part of the meal was the Thai tea!
Great food & service! Scrumptious and delicious food. We will definitely come back soon!

It's a nice place to get Thai food! Usually delicious without a doubt but the service sometimes is hit or miss. I've had dining occasions where everything came out perfectly timed and had a flawless experience. I've also had experienced where the boyfriends entree came out before the appetizer. Then his pre dinner soup 5 min later then the appetizer 5 min later. THEN 10 min later MY entree showed up and my boyfriend was already done eating. They gave a 10% discount off the whole bill which was a nice recovery. She was also extremely apologetic which helped. Hopefully she learns from this mistake because this is a huge no no in food and bev.
Just great food.  The curry dishes are to die for!  Good service and attentive staff.  Highly recommend.
Celebrated the DH's birthday here. Tasteful decor, attentive wait staff, and most importantly, delectable food.

I wanted to try a new place and found this place!  It was the best Pad See Ewe with fried tofu I have ever had.  The egg rolls were great too.  My new go to place when I want Thai food.  Definitely recommend this place!
Stay away from here if you're on your lunch break, sat and waited 40 damn minutes for our food that  never came and was never started. Terrible service

That jasmine rice alone is something special!! I love the ribs, chicken on a stick & the cucumber salad!!!! The food is always presented so neat & beautiful.  I'm convinced this place just might be addicting...

This place is really good! When we go here we usually get their delightful noodles, crab wanton and chicken panang.  Their delightful noodles are so amazing it has thin rice noodles with tomatoes, green onions and amazingness. It is perfect if your looking for something light and not something very spicy. There crab wanton are one of my ultimate favorites. They are so crisp and always made to perfection. There chicken panang is good too but I sometimes feel it is a bit watery and should be a little thicker.  Every time we go here we always get the best service and the people that work there are very nice and take very good care of you.  If you like Thai food try this place out, you won't be disappointed.

I like the decor, I like the people, I like the food.... but i wonder why no one ever visits it. Every time i go to the restaurant, My wife and I are the only ones there. SO I encourage everyone to try this place out. Its worth the money. If not, so the restaurant.com for a discount.

Disclaimer: I have a slightly unnatural Thai food obsession. And now..on to the good stuff  Came in with a party of four on a Friday around 5:30. Place was full I open tables. We ordered bang bang shrimp and spring rolls as appetizers. My fellow dinner mates said the shrimp was on point and the summer rolls were fresh. We also had the wonton soup and tom kha with chicken. I do not eat meat but I tasted both broths and they were so so so YUMMYYY..tangy and lemony. As an entree I had the green curry with tofu, which I asked for "spicy." Seriously, they are not playing here, the curry definitely was spicy. My one complaint about the curry is that it was really lacking in the liquid department, which made it more like a tofu entree than a curry for me...still delicious though.   Service was just ok, the waitress seemed to be in a rush any time she came to our table.   We will definitely be back!
Finally! Some descent Thai food. Been a few years since I was satisfied with descent Thai. Ordered deliverd. Will be back for some more serious dishes. All was good!

My boyfriend and I dine in occasionally, but most of the time we take advantage of their delivery service. Sure, it's just a couple of minutes down the road, but you know how it is when you get lazy.  Our few experiences at the restaurant have been pleasant. We've never had to wait for seating. The service is always prompt. We've had the same waitress during each visit and she always has a smile on her face.  We've come to like their Chicken Pad See-Ew with Chinese broccoli and their Beef Satay dinner. It's more than enough for the two of us. The satay is always tender and well seasoned and the fried rice that accompanies it is quite flavorful. The Pad See-Ew, though it is one of our favorites, can be off sometimes. Most of the time it's spot on (the chicken is tender and the noodles are al dente), but there have been a couple of occasions where it has been bland or too peppery. But again, it's not all the time and that's why we continue to get it.   We have, also, tried their Garlic Short Ribs, Wings of Angel, Shrimp Panang Curry, Pad Thai, and Tom Yum Soup. Everything has been good, so far, so we'll continue to enjoy our friendly neighborhood Thai restaurant.

We got recommended by a friend so we gave it a shot  It is a bit further from Vegas Strips but it's worth driving and try. The interior is clean and chic. Service is warm welcome. Price is reasonable compared to the portion and the quality of food. Most importantly the taste is very good and considered authentic. I love the Beef sa-te, Spicy Crab noodle, fried banana. We definitely will go back and try more dishes. Sooooo yummy!!!

Don't really leave reviews. This is actually my third and the first two were only because they were sooooooooo bad. But this place is absolutely terrific.  Ordered too much for 2 people but finished everything, because it was so good. The scallops were very tender and the sauce had a nice kick. The duck rolls were absolutely fantastic. Best I've ever had. Lots of duck, tender wrap, and the Julianne veges in it.. The chicken satay was cooked perfectly and sauce was nice. Had a squid basil noodles that was very very good. The squid was tender and the dish has a lot of basil. Finally had a chicken mushrooms and asparagus dish that again was fabulous. And a special shout out to Apple who served us. Friendly attentive and overall great service. Wish she didn't give us dessert on the house, which of course I finished.. Argh..  Can't say enough about this place, will be back again and again. 5 stars!!!!

I tried the Pumpkin Curry Shrimp.   Loved It!   Best Thai Restaurant I have been to with excellent service, great atmosphere, great prices and absolutely delicious food.  Pad Thai was awesome too.   Going back again.
Amazing Thai food and a great atmosphere!  Family owned and operated! The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is clean.
Great food and price :) thanks to nana our waitress, look for her..

After several lunches, I have found this place has grown on me.  The flavors, the service, the ambience, and yes, even the price, are always on point.  Even the simple cup of soup served with the lunch special is delicious and comforting.  How does one make broth with vegetables taste like that? The next time I'm sick, I'm going to call in an order just for the soup.  The chili basil chicken with brown rice is my go-to menu item for lunch.  I like that brown rice is an option.  I also like the free refills on Thai iced tea.  I leave feeling satisfied and happy.
Hi chose chicken fried rice, which was very good enjoyed the nice portion that they offered and the large pieces of chicken.
Love this place especially for dinner. Nice ambience, good food and presentation of the platters. The ladies are very nice, very polite and attentive to your needs.

Food is great and staff have always been friendly. The Pepper steak is delicious and they have it on their lunch menu which is great. The crab wontons are really good too. Pad thai / pad see ew is good too. Restaurant is clean with quality ingredients

My experience here last week was mediocre. I split the beef skewers and shrimp appetizer with the table and both were well done. For my main meal I had typical chicken pad thai, which was nothing special. The thai iced tea, on the other hand, was amazing! This place has very slow and inattentive staff, and not the most comfortable atmosphere. All in all, I would order in from here next time.
Valentine is my fave and the BEST server!! This place has great food-ALL OF THE FOOD IS TASTY! I'm here for lunch... and dinner a lot!

Easily the best quality Thai food in Vegas. The servers are very welcoming and attentive. The price may be a little up there but their creative food selections are worth it. I love the fish salad, beef pad see eu, crab fried rice, pad Thai, and Thai iced tea. Be careful with the spice level (as with most Thai places I suppose). What's nice is that the flavors can stand alone with or without spice.

This is one of the best Thai food restaurants in Las Vegas. We saw the reviews and had to try it out for ourselves to see what everyone was raving about. Now we know how good this place is! We were amazed from start to end with the service, quality, and easy to read menu with lots of pictures illustrations for those that never had Thai food could easily understand. I ordered the basil mint noodle combination and my wife ordered the Coconut  Thai shrimp soup which both were delicious and amazing. Our friends ordered the pumpkin curry which she said was really good and our other friend ordered the crying tiger beef which he said was no crying matter...lol  This place is a true gem and one of our new favorite places to eat at. We will definitely be coming back.

The food is delicious! Restaurant is clean. They have great dish presentations. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Their prices are reasonable as well. We have dined here twice and enjoyed it both occasions. Definitely a place to check out!
Mongolian Beef is where it's at. Best Thai food we have ever had. Probably the only restaurant we will ever rate 5 stars.

I have tried panna thai a few times and I've never been blown away by anything I have ordered. I normally do pick up and they are pretty quick (ready in about 10-15 minutes)  The chicken pad Thai ($8.50) is pretty bland flavor wise but the spice level is pretty spot on (I typically order a 4 or 5 spice level). I have also tried the yellow chicken curry ($8.95) which is just OK. All of the items range from about $5-$18 apps to chef specialities and the portion size is pretty good especially for the price point.  I'm not in any big rush to come back but overall food was decent at a good price.

Nice place. Very elegant decor.  Had a craving for Thai after studying for finals so i went during dinner time on a Monday night. Not exactly "A" material.  Pad Thai (Chicken) 7.50 For a togo order it was a bit...small. Other places fill the whole box up but one section was left empty for a wedge of lime and ground peanuts, that section could have had a few extra strands of rice noodle! Taste wise it was...sub standard. It was missing a lot of spicy and strong flavors associated with Thai food. Sugar must have been on sale, bit into a large piece of scrambled egg and tasted more sweet then egg, or sauce, or spicy for that matter.  Yellow Curry (Chicken) 8.75 Piggybacking on the Pad Thai, yeah sugar was on sale cause there was more sweetness then anything else in this curry. Had slices of chili but no heat. Very weak curry essence. Strong coconut milk presence.  If this place was an authentic Thai restaurant it would get Zero stars. But they advertise as an Americanized Thai restaurant so for that they get the job done.
Food Is pretty good for Thai in the Western region of Vegas

Nothing out of the ordinarily bad or good with this place. It tastes like what it supposed to taste like. My wife and I both got curries and we enjoyed them both, they also give a nice side helping of white rice with it as well, being that some restaurants will not offer free side of rice with curry. All in all, if we are feeling some thai, we will be back!
Excellent food and service, Tom Kha chicken soup beyond amazing!  Wayne Gorsek
Always delicious,  good food, good service! Love the sate and all the appetizers. They have great lunch specials and oh the thai tea!
I ordered a bang bang shrimp and soft shell crab and those are wonderful!! Love it. Little suggestion, should have some noodle with a bang bang shrimp. It would be awesome.

I go easily twice a month and am in love with most of the food, it's close to home as well, adding convenience to it's charm!  I always order the monster which is a grilled shrimp salad, one that puts me in withdrawal after a week of not having it..     Stay away from the scallop tamarind dish and the steamed dumplings, two that I can recall that aren't stars on the menu..  Soo my issues come from the service, and yes I know that service may be lacking in a Thai restaurant.. 5 years ago!  I think it's an area that definitely needs attention and if their food wasn't as amazing as it is I wouldn't set foot in there again.      Tonight the server didn't greet us just walked up with a miserable expression saying "something to drink?", when did we give up on saying welcome, or how are you this evening or nice to see you again..  He took our order by pulling a piece of register paper out of his pocket, unwrinkled it and asked what we would like, leading to a deep sigh once I ordered two courses.  Mind you it's 8:45pm and the door says open until 10pm.     We finish eating our amazing dinner minus the steamed dumplings, not that they knew of us not liking them since no one asked us if our meal was good at any point.  Then that wonderful server came over dropped the check and reluctantly offered to box up some left over pineapple curry and rice.  I never asked for the check so when he came back I said "can we not get dessert?"  He said "the kitchen closed at 9:45" and I followed with "the door says you close at 10" it was 9:48.. his response "that's what time the restaurant closes"..     I was annoyed at this point and suggested they adjust their sign, or at least give their guests the option to order at 9:45..  Why let sales walk out the door?  I spent $50 on Thai food and undoubtably would have purchased two desserts!  Unfortunately we will probably skip this restaurant next time I crave Thai food and start a search for my next favorite.  It's a shame because the food really is delicious.
So yummy.  this is my second time ordering from here on Eat 24. Everything is delicious. My favorites are the tom yum soup with shrimp and the sweet basil with tofu. Quick and friendly delivery girl.
I used to be a fan until today. First of all I know what chicken tastes like.  what I was served today was not chicken.  The server today no comments. My order was all jacked up.
The food was passably good. I would say not as flavorful as some other options in the valley and the delivery took almost 2 hours. But overall, not a bad choice for middle of the road Thai.
One of my favorite restaurants in town, Panna Thai always has great food. I don't think I've tried anything from their menu that I don't love.

I love the food, I love the service, and I love the prices. I use Restaurant.com to get a discount to this place. The Pad Thai is decent, The Panang is Awesome! The Pad See Ewe is good too. That is pretty much all I ever order, so I have no opinion on other dishes. It is not the best I ever had, but it is darn good and with the friendly and fast service, and great price, you can't go wrong!
Awesome place! Great customer service! And if you want to experience authentic thai food this is the place to go, oh and the price is fair!

Had dinner with my friend here last night. Haven't really been a big fan of Thai food but really did like this place. Its a small, quaint place. We were welcomed right away and seated. They were not super busy but the place was adequately filled.    I had the duck salad very tasty. I love duck and had never seen it served as a salad so had to try it. It was served over a bed of spinach, not sure I loved that but the dressing was delicious.   I will have to try this place again!

Everything was great! We ordered grilled chicken skewers YUMMY, BBQ beef salad BOMB, Tom yum soup Spicy sour and good! Pad Thai with shrimp, spicy eggplant wasn't too spicy it was ok!  Def will be our new Thai spot since it's close to home!
The crab noodles are amazing!  The house wine is quite good.  Have had the pleasure of eating here several times and the service is great and all items on the menu so far were wonderful!
Great authentic Thai restaurant. Amazing service and an amazing staff. Located on Patrick and forte pache it is like a hidden gem. I would recommend trying the tom kha soup.

Ordered today and wasn't a big fan of what I got. The egg rolls were the highlight of the meal but the duck was very dry and didn't taste good at all. This was a carry out order so dining in could be much better but I probably won't try to find out.

It's not the best Thai I've ever had but it is fantastic for the price. I love when places like this have pictures of almost every dish in the menu so you can see what you're ordering even if you don't know how to pronounce it. The crab Rangoon is a great app shared among friends. I've tried a few of the interesting soups and the Chicken Pad Thai.  The staff is always friendly though their English isn't the best. I haven't taken advantage of their delivery services yet but it's nice to know they deliver since they're only a couple of minutes from my house.
Great selection on the menu. The food is consistently good. The staff is always friendly.
I had the ahi tuna salad.. It was very good.. The dressing was a wasabi/soy sauce flavor.. I usually don't eat wasabi but it went beautifully with my salad. Nom nom nommm

I decided to give this place a try and I was pleasantly surprised.  I've been back several times since.  I love the pineapple curry chicken and my friend loves pad thai.  His favorite part is that they bring you a tray with fresh peppers, red pepper flakes, and other fixings so you can adjust the heat of the dish to your taste.  We also mentioned on our first visit that we would have like some cilantro and they've remembered that request every time we've visited since.  Great staff, friendly service, wonderful food!
