This place has amazing food but they literally mess up your order EVERY SINGLE TIME    Doesn't matter if you give your order in person or detailed instructions via online ordering, they can't figure it out.

This is one of my go to spots for awesome Thai food.  They are located near my old house and we frequented it at least 2 times a month. I am a huge fan of all of their appetizers, but their entrees make this place shine. I have tried many Thai restaurants in town, but this one still beats them all by food quality and price.  I love their pad see ew, it's hard for me to stray from that, but all of the other dishes I have tried are amazing as well. Ranging from their beef/chicken satey, crab noodle, fried rices, and soups, I can't find a single negative thing to say.  Definitely recommend if you're in the neighborhood, and if you're not, make the drive and see for yourself. Also need to mention, their prices are unbeatable.  Most plates are all under $10, you can't find that quality of food at that price anywhere in town!

Went here after a friend recommended it and we loved it.  Took a restaurant.com certificate, which really saved some cash as well.  We were 3 of us, and ordered chicken satay and 4 entrees, and with tip the bill was $29.  The portions are larger than most other That restaurants in town, and the food was generally as good as Pin Kaow.  The chicken satay was excellent.  The pineapple curry was very good, as it had strips of shredded chicken, and a nice spicy bite to it.  The pad se ew was good, although to be honest, I think Pin Kaows is better.  That being said, it was still good.  We also had a glass noodle dish called Beautiful Noodle, or something like that, which my wife really enjoyed.  Overall, the service was good and friendly, the food was very good, and the price was phenomenal.  I will definitely be going back.
Went here for lunch.  Fast, cheap, and the best Thai food I have ever eaten!  Can get busy at lunch time but it is worth checking out.

Panna Thai is a cozy restaurant in the corner of a strip mall. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is above average for a restaurant of this size and popularity.  The wait staff was fairly attentive and friendly.  I had the beef salad, which they do a little differently than most Thai places... the beef is done barbeque style, so it has a smokey flavor. Overall I prefer the more traditional pan-seared marinaded steak for this dish.

I just ordered 5 dishes. All were supposed to be extra spicy and only 1 is spicy. All the rest are "mild". It even says it on the receipt. It's really annoying when a restaurant can't get an order right. I live 39 min away and am not coming all the way back to have them fix it. Just wasted $60 on bland thai food.

So I am 6 1/2 months pregnant and have been craving Thai food. I was SO excited to try this place. I called and ordered A LOT of food. I ordered  Pepper steak Spicy pad Thai  Golden cups  Royal duck Bang bang shrimp Pad se ew beef Thai tea  When I called to order I had my husband there reading off that I wanted and he texted me what I told him I wanted because I wanted to make sure NOT to forget.  When I ordered the pad Thai the male and I discussed how hot I wanted it.  The food took an hour to come and it was cold, but I was STARVING so I didn't really care. My husband pointed out that there was food missing so we checked and it was the Spicy Pad Thai. I wasn't upset, shit happens so I just called and the guy I spoke to apologized and said they will make it and bring it right over.  Soon after I get another call and it was the guy that I originally spoke and who took my order and he said I didn't place the order. I reminded him that he and I spoke about the hotness of the pad Thai and he said yeah, but it wasn't ordered so I need your credit card number again. He said I will leave a note when you order again to give you something free and I said no thanks, I won't be ordering again.  The food is really good, but it took an hour to be delivered and then they accuse me of lying and won't fix what they messed up. I will have this resolved tomorrow during business hours... Guaranteed!!!!!!

So this is the 3rd restaurant we hit for my birthday dinner marathon.  =)  The food really deserved the 5 star rating, and I'd take 0.5 star off for the waitress failing to refill our water/tea.  Since I had to round it, 4 star it is.  The three of us ordered one appetizer, one salad, and two entrees.  Satay Combo - two beef and two chicken skewers grilled to perfection!  I'd say that Panna Thai delivered the juiciest beef Satay in town!  Yum-wun-sen (the silver noodle salad) - there were only 4 shrimps in this salad and no any other seafood.  I'd say this is seasoned to appeal to the locals since it did taste kind of  "americanized."  BBQ Spare Rib - Fork tender and falls right off the bone!  The sweet BBQ sauce wasn't just poured on, it was completely absorbed by the meat itself.  Sweety Duck -  I have to give this two thumbs up.  I'd say we eat duck pretty often since we visit the Cantonese restaurants in town all the time.  The Sweety Duck is up there with the tops, if not, even better!   The decor and atmosphere are WAY better than the Noodle House 2 that's only one block away.  We'd definitely come back again!  **special thanks to Julie C. who recommended this hidden gem that's very close to where I live**

The customer service was good.... But that's it... The foods were so tasteless I wasn't sure what I ordered. The fried rice was the only one that had any taste to it, the noodle didn't taste like much.... The tofu green curry... It didn't taste like anything and for the price I paid the portion was small barely any curry in it. And the Thai tea was way to sweet... I original came here because it had such good reviews so my expectations were high, but come on... Did these people pay you to write good reviews??? Did you actually eat the food????

Ordered delivery through Yelp and it was prompt and the portions were generous! They also gave me a free Thai iced tea. I ordered the crab fried rice, pad Thai, and BBQ spare ribs. The meat on the ribs was fall off the bone delicious. The crab fried rice was LOADED with crab. Like there was more rice than crab which I think is great. Pad Thai was good, I'm not raving about it but overall I'd order again!
Pad Thai & Massaman Curry both we're good. Delivery arrived when expected.  Left special instructions to call when arrive, which they did.  Would recommend.

Wow what a incredible find I have been here a lot the food is fantastic I mean you can close your eyes and pick anything on the menu and it is 100% yummy and delicious I am telling you it's carzy this is the only place I have been to in vegas batting 100% all day everyday do you know the dedication that takes... I met the owner Joe he is absolutely an incredible guy if you don't eat here at least once when you visit Vegas you half wasted your trip ... yes the food is that good... .yummy

Panna Thai is just up the road from my office and is a convenient lunch spot.   The food here is good - very good - and the service is always friendly.   I'm not an overly adventurous eater of Thai food, so I stick with pad thai, pad see ew or curry dishes.   All of those dishes are well made and flavorful at Panna Thai.   The wait time for food can be a little longer than I would expect at times, depending on busy they are, but nothing too terrible.

The good... This is the best Thai food in Vegas, period. Price. Decor.  The bad... They should cover\hide the storage area so customers don't see it.  I don't give 5 star ratings unless the food is really excellent.

What a gem I've found over on the west side! They have got the best pad Thai noodles around and an awesome lunch special! It's over at 3pm so if you can make it, try this place out! You won't be disappointed! Valentine has been my lunch time waitress the last few times and she is a sweetheart! All the staff is amazing though, very attentive and kind. I am a Loyal customer for sure!
Every time I call they look up my number by my phone number and they have a history of my order. So easy and efficient. They're super friendly and they offer great customer service! Thank you!

Was amazing until they got a new chef (Feb '17).  I had 2 or 3 very unsatisfactory deliveries and insisted the next time we go for dine in.  Last night we ordered a couple simple dishes and the were all terrible.  Soft shell crab wasn't crispy, the batter tasted like a mouth full of pepper and was soggy.  The flautas used to be my girlfriends favorite; now she won't even finish half an order.  The pork jerky was undercooked (I'm at a loss for how this is even possible).  We ordered the combo basil noodle last night and it was horrific. The thing with this type of dish is because there are so many components with different cooking temperature you really have to know what you're doing...this chef obviously doesn't. The pork component was well overcooked while the shrimp were half translucent still.  I don't mean to be harsh here but this was one of the best Thai restaurants in the US for a long time and now it's just....pesh.

i dont even know where to start. THE SERVICE OR THE FOOD!!! OMG, service sucked and the food was disgusting. I walked through the front door and the chef and servers were just staring at me for 2 minutes before i even got greeted with a hello or how may i help you? Then we get seated and it was another 5 minutes before someone came and asked for our drink order. NOT TO MENTION..... this was during SLOW HOURS... it was 4:30pm in the afternoon.... the only customers at the restaurant besides us was another table of 2 sitting 3 tables down from me. We finally got a chance to order after 8-10 minutes. I ordered the chicken satay & green curry with beef and vegetables. The chicken satay lacked flavor and marinate but the peanut dipping sauce that came with it was actually decent... but they only gave you a tablespoon amount for 4 skewers of chicken. The beef green curry arrived and i was disappointed by the flavor. It was watery and it lacked curry flavor... and the veggies weren't even cooked completely.  ....anyways... i wont be coming back. the food was too pricey for the crappy service and poor quality food. I'll rather go to Archi's or Thai noodle house down the street!!

Ordered take out which was ready promptly at the promised time. We had pad see ew & egg rolls, noodles were alright, a big mushy & didn't have a ton of flavor. My husband & I both commented that it was "just ok." The egg rolls fell into that same category. Had very high hopes due to the positive reviews but this just fell a bit flat for us. Maybe it's better when it's eaten in the restaurant?
I have been here a few times so thought I should give a review. The food is very good and the staff is nice.

The decor was nice and exotic... food was decent. But the SERVICE OMG. We waited forever... and I had to go ask if someone could come and get our order.  They did not even give us anything to drink after we sat down.  I think the place is new, but seriously, if you wanna open a restaurant, train your servers. The whole experience would have been at least four stars if we did not have to starve.
Just ate a paper towel that was in my soup! I thought it was cabbage. I just walked out without paying of course. The waitress chased me down to apologize, but I will never eat here again!

This place used to be a staple of mine but not anymore. I have been coming here for approximately 3 years and the quality has steadily declined.  It used to be so good I would frequently drive 30+ minutes just to get it. The beef Pad Thai used to be the absolute best in the city--tender beef, perfectly cooked noodles and full of flavor. For about the last year I have been getting anything but that. I kept coming back thinking that the flavor and dish that I loved so much would be revived. Well, after receiving these extremely dry, bland noodles and beef today I will never come back here. Please don't waste your time and money eating here. Find some place other than Panna if you are craving really delicious Pad Thai because I'm sure you will be as disappointed as I have been over this last year.

This review is going to sound harsh, so let me preface by saying that I tend to review Thai restaurants based on my own opinion of the flavors in the food.  This means that quality of service, atmosphere, etc. are not necessarily going to sway my review much.  With that said, this place had GREAT service.  Even though I came in with a coupon for $25, I felt like a regular customer within minutes!  The atmosphere is very upscale, and easy jazz music fills the dining area.  Oh, and they do have good Thai tea.  Now on to the food!  I ordered the tom kha soup with chicken (khi), the papaya salad, and the green curry with beef.  None of these were very memorable or impressive, unfortunately.  I also think that they Americanize a few dishes to some degree, but not as much as some other Thai restaurants.  The Tom kha was sweet with no lemongrass or galanga root.  The over all flavor was quite Americanized, in my opinion, and there wasn't anything that really stood out here.  The papaya salad was vinegary in flavor, and otherwise not notable.  The papaya was very crunchy though.  The green curry was suggested by my waitress as her favorite curry, although she didn't seem very enthusiastic about her own choice.  The green curry was a bit thicker than a lot other places, however it was rather light in the flavor department.  It seemed more like a stew with coconut juice mixed in.  On the plus side, it wasn't overly sweet.  The beef was a little tough though. I asked the waitress if the sweet sticky rice with custard was extremely sweet, or just a little sweet... she said that it was too sweet for her, so I passed on the dessert.    Overall, I would say that it would be very easy to fall in love with this place if I lived in the area, and I didn't have a particular taste when it comes to Thai food.  However, I can't say that I can squeeze in that extra star for Panna Thai due to my picky, snobby opinions.  Sorry, Panna!

All you can drink Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee?!? You can't get that kind of hookup nowadays. This is my spot!   My Thai iced coffee was strong and sweet, just the way I like my men -and- coffee. Ha. I swear they topped off my large glass about 4 times while I was there. I even left with a large cup to-go! You bet I was wired off my ass by the end of the night. No regrets!   Polite and helpful service with generous portions of flavorful Thai food - and the price is fair?! I'm seriously loving this place. Here's what we tried:  * Chicken pad Thai ($8.95) - extremely moist chicken with juicy noodles! It was super flavorful and a heaping size! 5/5  * Beef pad see ew ($8.95) - fat, phat, noodles done right! Everything was moist, seasoned well and the beef was also super tender. 5/5  * Chicken and beef satay with peanut sauce, egg fried rice and cucumber salad ($12.95) - we were able to get a mix of 3 beef & 3 chicken tender skewers. Great flavor. I also loved the peanut dipping sauce!  Get extra. So good. 5/5  * Bang bang shrimp appetizer ($8.95) - this was my least favorite dish. The curry sauce was a little lackluster, watered down and the shrimp flavor was off. My party enjoyed this appetizer, but then again they aren't as critical as I am. 3/5  * Coconut sticky rice with mango (mango sticky rice)($6.95) - a perfect end to an amazing dinner! I always feel like you need a special occasion to eat this, but man, I'll make an exception to have this every time I dine here! They make it exceptionally yummy! 5/5  I love the fact that they offer free refills on the drinks! That alone made me a strong believer. It's just a huge bonus that their food is also tasty and juicy! Panna Thai, put that on your radar. ;)

I thought this place was going to be amazing after seeing these reviews. I have ordered twice from here and both times it's super disappointing not good at all!! How is Thai food bland. Tom Ka soup tasted like sugar water w boiled chicken w raw button mushrooms (didn't know those were Thai) papaya salad is pretty hard to mess up but it's horrible. Waste of money so sick and was looking forward to this. Such a let down. Don't believe the hype!!

The food is great the service was fast and friendly. I came at 11am no crowd, but what impressed me the most was seeing the entire staff sit together for a meal I'm assuming family ties. It's always nice to see the employees enjoying the food they serve speaks volumes

Found this place through a buddy of mine..decided I would try it out and ordered delivery that took 2.5 hours to get my food..by the time the food reached my door it was cold and I had no interest in eating it..if you're lookin for Thai food go with Basil and Lime. They are much better and tend to take their job seriously as well as care about the consumer.

It is difficult to find a Thai restaurant with bad food, but to find one that is also cool and modern is just what we needed.  Plus: The food, the services and the location is amazing. Plenty of easy parking space available as well.  Cons: None that I could find so far other that they asked me like 25 times I wanted more Chai tea.

I have eaten here twice now and each time it has been great! I food is always fresh, the customer service is always great. The staff is friendly, the restaurant is very clean. I usually go to thai spice or pho kim long but moving forward I will be going to Panna. I had the monster salad w/ shrimp, spring rolls and iced tea. Enjoy!

This is my favorite restaurant on the Southwest side. My family and I eat here almost weekly and are never disappointed. Every time we come we have excellent customer service and food. Their Pad Thai is the best and vegan friendly!! Very consistent + yummy.

I like this place! I get the yellow curry (spicy!) which isn't as thick as I like it but it's still really good and flavorful. My husband is more adventurous then I am and he's never been unhappy with his order. The staff is friendly and very accommodating when it comes to special requests. The portions are also just the right size.

They have lunch specials here every single day, not just on weekdays. My go to here is the sate chicken skewers. Their peanut sauce is to die for! I wish they would sell it bottled so I could hoard it.   I went with a group and everyone was satisfied with their meals. The lunch specials were served with a good amount of food, not too much or too little. Sunday around noon was not busy and we got great service.   For dessert, I had the Thai sweet sticky rice topped with homemade coconut ice cream inside of a shaved coconut. Yes, you read that right. It sounds as good as it tastes too! Yummy!!!! It's not on the menu in the exact way I got it, but the waitress told us about it and we couldn't resist.   I need to go back here to try more items on the menu. I liked it a lot!

I've been to many thai restaurants in Vegas, but this one is my favorite. Why? Because they have the best sticky rice and pork jerky! I can't get enough of that stuff. Reminds me of eating on the streets of Thailand. They also have a great beef sate, its hard to find good sate, a lot of times you'll end up with a rough, dried piece of meat on a stick but not here, its tender and delicious! But if you're in the mood for something simple, try the pad see-ew, really good, the noodles are cooked so perfectly. I love it when I eat pad see-ew and there's that frangrant smell of the stir-fried noodles, can't really explain it, but it smells soooo good!
the best thai food in vegas hands down!!! their pineapple fried rice is to die for!!

This place is delicious!! I've seen this place a few times and finally decided to stop in for dinner, I'm glad I did. The food is great and all of the staff and servers were super friendly! I had the crab wontons to start, the shrimp pad thai, boyfriend had the Bbq pork soup everything was delicious, can't wait to come back again and try more food!!

I always enjoy coming here...  I would always come here on a weekly basis because I used to live a couple of blocks away... It has a nice ambiance... Servers are very nice and attentive... I always order the Garlic Short Ribs, Beef Panang, Shrimp Pad Thai, Fish Herb Salad, Beef Sate and Thai Iced Tea to wash it all down with...  I recently visited this place over the weekend and the menu is updated with a larger selection with photos.  Over the years the place has gotten better and better.

My boyfriend and his brother and I all ordered take out we waited a long time to get our food! The waitress was sooo rude she was getting impatient when we were ordering. Then we asked if she can bag in two bags and she gave us so much attitude. By the time we got our food we decided to eat there. We asked for water the guy ignored us then I asked and didn't even acknowledge us. Then he gave us our water finally they never checked up on us none of that. Then we wanted a refill and he told us to hold on with hella attitude. Then he goes to his coworkers and proceeds to talk shit and points at us. It was completely noticeable. And keep in mind there was no one else there we were the only ones. So it wasn't like it was super busy. When we were done eating the guy came up to us and said "are you going to get your fucking food?" And my boyfriend said "we're done eating thank you." Then the guy said "pick up your trash don't leave it here." Then I butted in and said "it's your fucking job to clean up the mess if you don't like your occupation then quit." Then we walk out and he started pacing the window like he was going to come out and get us. Overall the food was great. But the customer service was shit! I recommend not to go there.

We like coming here as it is close to the house.  Whenever I crave Pad Thai and Papaya salad this is where I need to be.  They know we're regulars so they alway serve us well and give us complimentary desserts.  Sometimes they already know what we want to order. LOL!

First of all, after waiting almost 20 minutes, I had to leave my table to ask for a glass of water. I ordered crab fried rice with no egg extra garlic. I also explained, I have a allergy to egg. When the plate arrived, it had lots of egg. I explained to Ann, the order was incorrect. Ann was so unbelievably rude. She tried to convince me that the egg needed to be in the plate even after I explained for the second time, I have an allergy to egg. Even after correcting my order, I waited  20 minutes after I was done eating for  the check  to arrive to my table.  Not once did they come by to pick up my plates so I just put it in the table next to me. Jump is the name of another employee there and honestly he was very professional and apologized then tried to encourage  me to come back. Unfortunately, first time impressions last forever and I will never come back.   Becomes of the nice guy named Jump I  gave a two star instead of one.

food awful, very spicy, waitress didnt speak english. ordered dish made me choke. they made me pay for it.  stay away dont go here. i will tell many, many people.  bad food, bad service,  may 22, 2015.
This is my go-to Thai place in town. Everything I have ordered tastes great and their lunch special is a great deal.

Food was satisfying, service was good, and dessert was delightful!   I have to say though... I've had same dessert twice, Sweet Sticky Rice w/ Homemade Coconut Ice Cream & the quality/ taste the 2nd time was not as great.  My Favorites: Fried Calamari - Parmesan cheese?! Yup & it was goood. Chili Basil (Beef) - Savory Pad See-Ew - Good Yellow Curry - Full of Flavor & Spices

This place has finally won me over again! Despite of my last review I wanted to give this place another chance because it was one of my favorite places to get Thai food.   This time around I came to dine in during my lunch break. It wasn't busy which I appreciated because I was having a short lunch today. They had recently changed their menu so when I had ordered the "monster salad" the waiter looked at me clueless. It's now called the "grilled shrimp salad".  My salad came out as quick as I devoured it!  It was so delicious. It had just the right amount of spiciness where you can still eat it and not kill your taste buds. They were not cheap with the shrimp either. They put so much shrimp I finished the veggies and I still had shrimp left over. Writing this review makes my mouth water.. I want more! I want more! Lol

Made a stop here for lunch today after checking out the reviews.  Lunch hour wasn't that busy and I was seated rather promptly.  The server was polite and provided the lunch specials as well as the full menu.    Their menu has the classics along with some unique dishes  (ie. Salmon nuggets, Chicken curry fettuccine).  After some delay I ordered the cucumber salad as a starter and the Sweet Basil Chicken with steamed broccoli (they offer sliced or ground chicken options which is nice.  Overall assessment was that the staff was attentive, flavors of the main dish needed some work (ie. Soggy and cold egg roll, watered down sauce for the Sweet Basil Chicken - some "sliced" pieces were stringy and varied in size, and the veggie soup that comes with the special is mainly cabbage while still bland). Thai restaurants run rampant here in the city, so I was hoping it would compete well amongst Gata Thai, Naga Thai, Weera and even Pin Kaow. A 3-star rating is a fair grade. I'll continue to save my Thai cravings for the Henderson area.

I've been to several Thai restaurants in our area and stumbled on to Panna. One word...amazing!! The Bang Bang shrimp with crab curry is out of this world! The garlic beef was filled with unlimited flavor. Best of all, our server Apple was so hospitable and gave us a complimentary dessert. The ambience is chill and the restaurant is very well kept. We plan on being regulars at Panna. Till next time!

First time here and the pics looked great but as one reviewer states the food was kinda bland. Wife and I had 3 items: panang (beef) garlic shrimp and diver scallops. Presentation was nice but I really don't go to restaurants for pretty food ... I wanna fill my belly!!! I decided that this is not my go to place for Thai food but I wanted to try bc the pics looked so appetizing.... like I always say ... try it ... you might like it!!!
Very clean place and food is delicious the only thing to work on would be service because it is pretty slow but I will go back for more

5 stars for the food.... Absolutely amazing..  I've only tried a few dishes but I can assure you the Pad Thai..  And BBQ spare ribs are worth every calorie in every bite..  The meat LITERALLY falls right off the bone..  Also really enjoy the summer spring rolls with peanut sauce without mint...  The only thing that is a turn off is the estimated wait time for delivery...  I was told over an hr but called back to cancel and they ended up delivering within 45 minutes... I popped my car tire and hadn't grocery shopped so I was seriously starving..  Overall love this place...  If I wasn't so hungry I'd wait the hr  with no problem!

I got a certificate off of restaurant.com for this place, so I decided to use it last night with my boyfriend and my brother.  We were greeted and seated when we came in. I handed the man the certificate and he looked at it and said okay. We got our water and looked over the menus.  We ordered chicken panang curry, bbq spare ribs, beef pad see ew, and beef pad Thai. Each dish was a medium in spicyness.   When we ordered, my boyfriend asked the waitress if it all comes with rice and she said that the ribs and curry did, so he asked her if it was enough for all of us or if we should order more rice. She said that we don't need more rice because we have the pad thai and the pad see ew and that's what you eat with the dishes. EXCUSE ME!? Who are you to tell us what we eat with our dishes? We're Filipino, we eat EVERYTHING with rice, even noodles! So of course we were a little embarrassed to even order anymore rice.   The food came after about 10 minutes. My favorite dish was the panang, sooo good! The ribs were really good also, so soft and soo flavorful. The pad see ew and pad thai were average.  The reason why I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 4 is because of their service. No one EVER smiled, asked us how we were doing, or initiated any type of conversation. I saw some other customers come in after us and the servers started talking to them, smiling, and even laughing, so they're obviously capable of doing so, they just didn't with us. I guess it's just one of those places that already have their favorite customers and don't do anything to try and get people to come back.   Good food, poor attitudes = 3 stars

I love me some Thai and this strip mall wonder is a thunder from down under, spicey as you want it, with a nice kick.   We had the beef jerky appetizer and it was perfectly done.   We also had a duck soup, mmmmm...so good, and the wifey had drunken noodles, she loves getting drunken and having noodles too...lol.   Really, this place is pretty hot.  Not 5 star for vegas, but a solid date night no less.   Off the beaten path, so quite quite for the romantic evening.  Staff as stellar on service!
Ordered for delivery.  Food showed up 30 min late, was cold and they refused to address the problem and then blamed us and told us they said they were going to be late.  Are you kidding me?

Let me put it like this... if i was caught in the middle of the ocean on a deserted island and the only place to eat at was this restaurant.... i would most likely starve! :) simply put I've had better... Now! don't get me wrong; the restaurant as a whole is nice and the music that they play is very soothing an great!!! but the food not so much :(
Nice ambience! Location is convenient! Food is tasty! Very quiet and the prices are pretty fair! Definitely coming back

This is a great resturant, the food is good and so are the prices. I ordered the garlic ribs and pad thai or whatever it's called and it came out to be under $25, so it's a cheap dinner place for 2. Friendly staff aswell.
We decided to come here since it was close to home and ordered the basil chicken and basil noodle both very good dishes.  Thai ice tea was my delicious. This will be added to my favorite restaurants.

One of the better Thai places I have eaten.  I like going here for lunch because they are fast, cheap, and the food is good.  Service is polite and fast.  I have been here four times and have never had a problem.  Every time I tried a different dish and have liked them all.

I came here for dinner with some friends and... I totally love this place! The ambiance has more of a business casual vibe... Could be great for a date night... Or a business lunch :)    The servers were all very sweet and on top of the table. They made great suggestions for food and beverages. Our waters were always full and I never had to ask for another glass of wine :) (They only offer beer and wine).   They offer a large menu with lots of different veggie dishes! I was really excited about that! I ordered a red curry with lots of veggies! The spice level ranges from mild to extra spicy. I ordered spicy and could of definitely used more heat... So if you like hot... Make sure you are very specific. My friend ordered a yellow medium beef curry and loved it!! My other friends orders BBQ chicken with veggies and fried rice. Both said the chicken was really really good.   Dessert consisted of a chocolate lava cake with ice cream and fried coconut bananas with ice cream, neither of which I could eat... But the lava cake got some raving reviews!!   They have some really amazing lunches specials that I plan on checking out. I am really excited to go back!

This is the best Thai restaurant ever!  We eat at this restaurant every time we visit Las Vegas and every dish is just heavenly.  It's a short drive from the strip and definitely worth the break from the casinos. I celebrated my birthday here with friends and family.   We ordered the works - appetizer, soup, beef, pork, seafood, noodles, dessert, and others.  Luckily we were a big group so I got to taste all the dishes.  I highly recommend the Pad See-ew.  It's very tasty.  The coconut ice cream with sticky rice is served in fresh coconut.  You mix the ice cream with the sticky rice and it is just divine!  Thank you Panna Thai for making my birthday memorable!

Have dined in most of the Thai restaurants in Vegas and Panna stands out above the rest. Service is phenomenal, and the decor is extremely modern and well done. Now, I know some people enjoy the coconut type Thai food with the sweet tea, etc. etc, but I prefer the Tough Love from my Thai. Panna makes truly hot, spicy food that can easily bring a grown man to tears. I'm sweating a bit right now just thinking about it. So, if you like authentic hot spicy Thai food, Panna is definitely the way to go.

I went with a friend to get some Padthai, I got a level of spicy on my food, never again. It was so spicy I can feel it in my throat for 30 minutes. But I have to say, when its regular the food is DELICIOUS. Will return again.

Overly delish food! The curry and pad thai was the best ive had in a while! The guy with the accent working the desk was super fun! He was very helpful and really entertaining while i waited for my food. Hey, he even broke my Thai tea virginity! At no charge :) Great place high recommendation!

I rely heavily on Yelp reviews and this time around reviews failed me.    The restaurant setting is nice.  Service was so/so considering only 2 other tables and 4 servers.  Now, the food.  For Thai, this left me questioning where's the flavor!?!?  Ordered the garlic garlic shrimp and not only was the flavor lacking, so was the portion.  I wouldn't consider 8 pieces an entree by any means.  The chicken satay appetizer was decent but a bit tough/over cooked. On to the house fried rice...there was an odd sweetness and I couldn't pin it but based on the menu description I certainly didn't expect it.  At least there was a bigger portion with this dish.  Needless to say, this left me unsatisfied and wishing I had made the drive to my normal spot.  So much for finding a neighborhood Thai spot.

This is one of my new favorite Thai places in town.  First, I love the menu.  Lots of bright pictures to help you choose and overall great choices.  I tried the spicy crab noodles and while it smelled funny, it was delicious.  Tango salmon was another winner that I recommend.

There were two waitresses both very nice they greeted and seated up as soon as we walked in.  We both drank water. We got crab wontons... They were so good! Light and crisp with good amount of filling and crab taste. Sweet n Sour sauce with them tasted good.  Tom Yum soup sweet n spicy soup with mushrooms and shrimp was delicious. Good flavor, spice & lots of shrimp.  Cucumber salad... I HATE cucumbers for some reason but I tried this. It was amazing. So cool and refreshing with a lil onion in it and the dressing was nice. The cucumbers were actually great! I got basic chow mien with chicken... The noodles and veggies were good but the chicken was not. I should have gotten veggies only!  My bf got sweety duck. The sauce was good and it came with lots of broccoli. The sauce was yummy on the broccoli but the duck was very dry and pretty gross. :o(  Other than the meat everything was amazing! I'll def go back someday and try some more stuff or at least get the things I know I liked!!  They have a deal on restaurant.com, spend $35 get $25 off!

ALL YOU CAN DRINK Thai Iced Tea!!   To be honest... that is one of the main reasons as to why I decided to try this place. I saw a review that said they had free refills on thai iced tea which I had never heard of at any other resteraunt... hahaha  Service was good although we had a girl that was still new I guess... she was a little hesitant but she held through very well. I'm sure she just needed a little more training on little nit pick information. We were greeted right away & seated in a half booth table. The decor was clean & not so cluttered with high ceilings which gave the place a very spacious feel.   The food was overall delicious & they have the pickled Serrano chili peppers which is always a plus for me when it comes to thai places =]  THAI ICED TEA $3 - FREE REFILLS!!!! when you dine in that is... i would have to say it is a little bit sweeter than what i am used too... but that may be because its free refills. ahahha you can seriously only take down 2 glasses worth otherwise expect a tummy ache!  PEPPER STEAK LUNCH $6.95 - I was definitely expecting cubed steak pieces but they were more thin slices... but the flavor was still good. Served w/ rice,  small salad, & an egg roll.  ROYAL DUCK $7.95 - this was actually very DERICIOUS. Its duck w/ cream cheese & veggies wrapped in a soft tortilla.   SATE BEEF or CHICKEN $7.95 - on the lunch menu... we got both for extra charge. Served w/ cucumber salad, egg fried rice, & DERICIOUS peanut sauce which i also used to eat my pad thai as well!!  DUMPLING APPETIZER $6.95 - steamed dumplings in the shape of a bag so it's definitely cute I would say. Served w/ soy sauce & 5 pieces.  DUCK NOODLE SOUP $9.95 - hubby got this & he got it w/ egg noodles... I never seen him eat hot soup so FAST   SHRIMP PAD THAI $9.95 - when I ask for spicy... I get it! Noodles are perfect & the peanuts come on the side of the dish. Even though it is spicy you can still taste the flavors.   MANGO W/ STICKY RICE $6.95 - ummm this dessert is like a piece of ARTWORK!! Seriously it is so pretty that you don't want to eat it! The rice was also a PERFECT consistency of STICKY & chewy.
While the satay was the best that I've tasted in awhile and the fried rice was amazing!

This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Las Vegas.  I drive over 30 miles each way to this restaurant.   Service: Is always on par  Food: I love that they've added tapas style plates. I get to gave several of my favorite things at once.  Be careful when ordering a spicy dish. We ordered most of our food medium or a #8 and it was really hot.  I drank more water and ate less food.   Atmosphere: It's a typical table and booth dinning, nothing special.  There is a television for those guys who want to stay up to date on their games.

We have ordered food here about 20 times. We usually have it delivered and had had nothing but great experiences. The food is SO good, arrives steaming hot and delicious. This is our go to Thai restaurant. I LOVE their curries. I've had masaman, yellow, red, pineapple with chicken and tofu with added vegetables. We always get the crab wontons too. My husband gets noodle or soup. Always delicious!  Update, 3/30/18 I still love this place. I just picked up food to go. So delicious!!!!! Just everything...so perfect. I'm a fan.

This restaurant is just a pretty face with zero substance. Similar to an Australian male stripper I once met. Really nice to look at, but once he opened his mouth I couldn't run away fast enough. On to crappy Thai food.  I walk in and am instantly taken back by how current and sharp this space is. They spent money in making it look appealing and it does! They were also playing some current American music which was unusual to me, but I liked it. Only one table was occupied by a couple when I placed my takeout order.   The order taking was slightly awkward as I mentioned to the guy (because I am always entirely too friendly and can't help it. Unless I used expensive, yet bad moisturizer that is making my f*n face stink and the smell is killing me!), I mentioned that I have been dying to try this place.. He asked if I have ever had Thai food before. I wanted to ask him if he had ever brushed his teeth before. Again, I was nice about it. I placed my order for Panang chicken no rice and he then said," Medium or Mild". I responded with,"HOT". He gave me the look, but than wrote down my order. I paid and he said it would be a few minutes.....  I don't mind waiting because I am in an especially good mood these days. The only couple in the restaurant pays and leaves. The music is turned off. The music never comes back on. I waited close to 30 minutes in silence for my order. I would have waited longer if I didn't get up and walk towards the kitchen. It had been sitting there for who knows how long. RUDE. I smile, grab my food and leave.   Immediately I open the container upon walking in the door since I'm ravenous for some spicy curry. First impression- Panang sauce is really watery..... Second impression- Panang Chicken has tons of Thai chiles, but zero flavor other than heat. No basil or kaffir lime leaves. No complexity or richness to the sauce. Only pure coconut milk taste or lack of. Dinner fail.   I really wanted to like this place and had hopes that this would be my new go to Thai spot for date night, but they just don't deliver on any level here. My suggestion is go anywhere else in the area for Thai unless you belong to a Coconut Milk Meetup Group or something. In that case knock yourself out. Literally.

We love Panna Thai! My husband and I eat here at least once per month, sometimes more we love certain dishes but also branch out. Sme of our favorites include the panang curry, spicy eggplant, and the coconut soup. I have spent three weeks in Thailand and know that their favors at Panna Thai are close to the real deal. We order it with lots of heat and they do sometimes under-deliver but I'd rather have it not spicy enough the way too spicy. The service is always great, the dining room is always clean, and the food is always fresh and hot. One thing we'd like to change is to have fountain sodas instead of the can... But oh well. We definitely keep going back and keep telling our friends and coworkers, too.
I order from this place frequently. Food is always good and delivery always comes decently quick.

Panna Thai is a hidden gem! Food is consistently great. I dine here at least once a week, usually get the Pad Thai or Spicy Basil Chicken-both are delish! If you want an appetizer try the crab wontons, satay skewers or the cucumber salad. Staff is friendly and attentive. It's a must try!

Satay is something rather ubiquitous in my home country of Australia. Being situated close to South East Asia we have quality Asian restaurants in the same way the South Western United States enjoys incredible Mexican food. Satay dishes are so commonplace that in Australia they appear on the menu at regular Chinese restaurants.  Living in Vegas now I've missed satay and even though Malaysian satay (my preference) can be hard to find, Thai satay is an acceptable alternative. Panna Thai takes that alternative and makes it in the best possible way.  Every time we go here I order the Satay Chicken as a dinner portion and both sauce and chicken are incredible. It comes served with egg fried rice and the standard little cucumber salad and is delicious from first bite to last. The chicken is exquisitely basted and marinaded and the peanut sauce perfection itself.  When my wife and I go here we usually enjoy the vegetable summer rolls as a pleasant, fresh appetizer to share and she raves about her vegetarian pad thai with fried tofu.   I've also ordered the BBQ pork noodle soup which is similarly tasty, but overkill when you're ordering a big plate of Satay.  Service is always attentive and friendly.  My only real gripe with Panna Thai is their lack of a fountain drinks machine and the requirement to buy cans of Coke (or whatever) if you want something non-alcoholic other than filtered tap water. This, of course, means no soda refills.  Overall though, Panna Thai is a great option. Their menu might not be as extensive as some, but they have more than enough to satisfy everyone.
Order from here at least once a month, great food, great prices, fast delivery! Highly recommend
The food is great but the average time for a to-go order is about 45 minutes. The restaurant was about half full and they seem to have a full staff on the floor which why I don't understand the wait.

Great food, great prices. Everytime I order delivery always on time and accurate with my order. Food shows up hot and delicious. Panna is always my first choice for thai food. The Panang Curry is my favorite dish, if you get this get the combination you will love it. Wonton soup is some of the best soup I have ever had.  I always recommend Panna Thai over other restaurants in the area.

We order take-out from Panna at least twice a week.  Our go-to's are:  1. Eggplant & tofu skewers (love the sauce it comes w/) 2. Fresh veggie rolls w/o bean sprouts 3. Pad see eew no meat w/extra gailan aka Chinese broccoli 4. Cucumber salad - for our 20 month old 5. Coconut rice - for our 20 month old 3. Chicken wings w/Thai salsa  Love that we can eat healthy (minus the chicken wings), flavorful food while being semi-carb conscious and semi-vegan (ish lol).  The deliveries are always fresh and their delivery drivers are always super sweet.  Great service!  Hi Valentine, if you're reading this!

We had a restaurant.com gift certificate that needed using, so we headed down there.  When we walked in the door we were greeted with smiles and shown to our table in a very nicely decorated restaurant with good atmosphere.  To start with, we both had Thai iced teas that were fantastic and refilled before they were halfway empty. We shared a bowl of Tom Kha Gha, which was the best I've ever had.  For entrees, we had the Red Curry with Chicken and Sweety Duck, both of which were fantastic.  The duck was moist with a nice crispy skin and honey glaze, served with steamed broccoli.  The curry had a generous amount of meat and the veggies were fresh and not overcooked.    Dessert was the house specialty: Mango with Sticky Rice.  Excellent, though it's seasonal, subject to ripe mangos, so take advantage in the springtime! Homemade Coconut Ice Cream is also on the menu, though we didn't get to try it because we were stuffed.  As mentioned in other reviews, the portion size is generous.  Neither my wife nor I were able to finish our entrees and it was packed up with extra rice to take home.  Excellent, friendly service, good quality food at a reasonable price in a nice environment.  Adds up to 5 stars to me!  Oh, and they deliver.

The food was 5 stars all the way! Tuna tartar appetizer is a must....egg rolls and dumplings are great too! Service was extra slow! There were only two young ladies working the dining room doing everything...I felt bad for them but this made our experience slow and long. We will eat here again....I think we will just order take out and enjoy at home!

I will update this as I try more from here but last night I just ordered one dish.  They are my corner thai joint so I'm sure I will go back more.    I ordered the cashew stir fry which has dried chile in it but I asked for it spicier and I asked for broccoli with it.  Super plus they were very accommodating and didn't charge me extra.  The pick up was quick and easy and the portion was very large.  It was definitely spicy and there was lots of broccoli, my one side complaint would be that it had a bit too much fish sauce for a non fish dish.  But I will just make sure to ask them to tone it down on the fish sauce next time.  Other than that it was delicious and I quit enjoyed my meal.
I ordered the shrimp curry. It had the right amount of spiciness. It was fantastic.  So was the service! I love this place.  It's a hidden gem.
Amazing!!!! Very clean and beautiful! The food is great! (And I have experience with Thai food)

Nice, light, well done Thai food. The beef satay and veggie pad thai were deliciousssss, non-greasy, and well-priced. The service was awkward - the girl spoke English but she had trouble with our order (there was lots of staring and awkward pauses) and we ended up with someone else's order on our table. The mix-up was fixed quickly and everyone was very nice.  I'll be back to try more of their dishes.

This is our go to place for Pad thai and Pad see ew. The mango sticky rice is also a must try! Staff are attentive. The reason I gave this only 4 stars instead of perfect five is because of the dips/sauces they pair with some of their dishes. Some of it just doesn't go well with the dish. But overall still a great Thai Restaurant!
We were in town on vacation and wanted a quiet night in, so we had our dinner delivered. It was great. The Pad Thai was really good and the coconut ice cream was delish!

Good food but pretty terrible service. It took 15 minutes for the 1st course then another 40 minutes for the 1st entree to come out. Overall not a good experience, they didn't even ask how the meal was.

Excellent service, attentive but not intrusive while while we enjoyed our evening.  We started with Thai ice teas which include free refills - unheard in Portland.  Next was two scrumptious appetizers - potstickers and I believe was called yum yum shrimp - shrimp/crab in a curry sauce - wow! Next, we ordered three entrees - BBQ chicken, eggplant with seafood, and chicken with broccoli.  All dishes were well prepared - eggplant was ordered with no spice, and all flavoring a were savored with each delectable bite - yummy!! BBQ was moist and tender, some so rare to find in Portland.  My friends patronize Panna Thai occasionally but this was my first visit, I will be back!

The best MANGO CHICKEN!!! Very authentic and fresh thai food!! Everytime we order an entree we notice that they're not stingy when it comes to putting any meats & main dishes unlike other restaurants. Great service & a must try JASMINE GREAT TEA to wash off the whole meal.
Another AWESOME dinner at Panna Thai tonight! Great service and good food :P Thanks!  David

I ordered on EAT 24 and it said it would take 45-60 minutes.  It took almost two hours!  The delivery guy was super apologetic which saved me from being really angry.  I ordered the following: Yellow Curry ( chicken) Pad Thai ( Shrimp)  And Crab Rangoons  The curry.... Was kinda bland.. I ordered it to be spicy but it has barely any flavor at all... The chicken was good though.  Pad Thai was delicious, but for an extra $1 for shrimp there should be more Han just four of them in the dish... That's kind of a rip off. The pad Thai was tasty though!  Crab Rangoons were great, full of filling and there were a lot of them...  I'll order again from here but I'll skip the yellow curry, and skip ordering shrimp

Worst customer service ever. We waited for 15 minutes for water and our glasses were never full the entire dinner. There were two other tables so it wasn't a busy night. When the check came we paid and then they brought back a receipt with another amount. When we asked the waiter he said he had forgotten to add a few things an just ran it up instead of bringing back the revised bill. It's a shame the entire serving staff was so bad because the food was good. Ill stick to Archis.

My friend and I like this place. I think this restaurant is one of favorite tai food places in Vegas. It was very easy to find. My company had a yellow curry and a pineapple fried rice last time. Still so yummy!!

I am in LOVE! We ordered; Lunch Specials  BBQ Spare Ribs= Lots of tender meat with delicious tastey sauce. Comes with brown fried rice and wonton cripsy (this is so delicate, pretty and very tasty not greasy) Sweet & Sour Shrimp=It's not thick & overwhelmingly sweet, just perfect, served along with BIG shrimp, cooked to perfection plump & juicy with bell peppers, onions (i hate onions but I ate these!). White rice  All the specials were under $8 and came with soup of the day.  THIS IS THE BEST SOUP I HAVE EVER HAD! It's vegetable soup which had some bok choy, baby corn and sprinkles of heave because this is the most delicious non-meat broth I have ever tasted !   Don't hesistate to go, it's delicious and everyone is so friendly. This will be a weekly visit for us
Love their calamari! Tender in, crispy out. Not overcooled like many others I've had.  I love the pad see ew, and pad Thai. I try getting new things but I always find myself returning to the see ew
Great neighborhood Thai restaurant. Perfect for pick up or delivery. Dine in is ok ... wait staff is always friendly and we're never left waiting. Excellent coconut soup!!

My wife and I went there for supper last night. This place is close to where we live. It was my birthday and I just finished doing a 12 hours shift. Tired and hungry, wouldn't really care less driving to other Thai restaurants in the Chinatown area. It took a while for the two of us to get seated. No one was waiting in line, but the one hostess/server was busy serving the tables and taking take out orders. Hence the wait for a table.   We ordered wings of angel which was boneless chicken wings stuffed with a combination of minced pork and clear noodle, green curry chicken, pad thai, and duck noodle soup. The stuff chicken wings were excellent with just a perfect blend of seasonings in the minced pork and rice noodle. The duck noodle was also delightful. The soup had very nice flavor to complement the duck. The spicy green curry (even though we ordered it mild) was a little bit too hot for me. The pad thai was bland. Couldn't figure out why the pad thai (a staple in all Thai restaurants) was so tasteless. It wasn't until I got the bill that I found out the waitress put the order down with special instructions that said "no spice". No wonder it was bland.   I would definitely come back and try some more of their other dishes like the yellow and green curry. Well worth the money, especially since we had the restuarants.com coupon. When we arrived there wasn't too many tables seated, but when we were about leave the restaurant was quite full. Pretty good business for a Wednesday night.  I deducted one star for the pad thai.

Very tasty food. I will say that Pan Asian is my favorite but this place is a real close second to them! It's less than a half mile from my house so it will be a place I grab some to-go for. I had the spicy basil rice. Very very good. Lots and I mean LOTS of veggies, ton's of broccoli. Mushrooms and bean sprouts and fried egg and red peppers. I really enjoyed this. The portion size is tremendous. 4 people could have eaten this plate. My friend got the spicy tofu with pork. I was a bad girl and tried a carrot to see the flavor (she ordered a 10 on spice and I was worried), but it was real tasty too. Hers should have been hotter temperature wise. My came out steaming hot. We shared a cucumber salad and that was delicious. Chopped red onions and red peppers on top of cucumbers in a sugary dressing. YUM! Definitely coming back here. Service was eh. Nothing great, nothing horrible, but I do like a friendly waitress. Always rounds out the meal. But great food, huge portions make me a very very happy girl!

This restaurant continues to deliver excellence. Tried almost every Thai place in the valley; this is the best. Warm service, pretty restaurant that maintains a pleasant, calm atmosphere. Great place for couples. Very clean. Food is really good and reasonably priced. Pad Thai, green curry, basil beef, chicken salad, Tom Kha soup, fried bananas for dessert, all top notch and cannot be beaten in Las Vegas. Servers are friendly and caring, chefs are inspired, owner really dedicated to her business. If you miss this, you will miss out on the best. It is our only destination for Thai in Las Vegas.

Tried to order through Postmates but it was having some issues, so I called in my order & even though it was almost closing time they still took my order with no problem. Delivery was very fast and food was delicious! My bf and I had the lamb curry & panang curry.  We will definitely order from here again!!

Went to this spot because it was close to the Putt Park. Sadly Putt Park was a huge let down, but thankfully the restaurant was YUMMY!  We ordered a little bit of everything. The waiter was great. We were pretty much the only table there which can lead to servers being all over you or nowhere in sight but not our guy :)  I will definitely go back.

FAVORITE THAI FOOD!!! Omg! Where do I even start?!  Food- Awesome and Flavorful! We typically ordered spicy crab noodles and chicken panang curry! The spiciness is good and it's just bomb. Food comes out hot and fresh. We also get Thai coffee and tea. TIP: they have unlimited refills for Thai tea and coffee if you dine in  Service- Great and very personable. They get a lot of to go orders so just be patient with them. They are attentive. There's always just about 2-3 people on the floor so between them, phone orders and dine in it gets a bit backed up but it's a good sign since you know how much people likes their food.  Definitely always going to come back! Best Thai food in town. Highly recommended!

Love the foods here I'm a fan of Thai foods and I have been searching for the best Thai restaurant around Vegas for long period. Pad Thai is alway the dish that I order whenever I go to Thai restaurant. Still can't find a best Pad Thai in Vegas but Panna's pad thai  4/5 stars is what I give for my pad Thai ( less sauce will be better) . I ordered : bang bang shrimp ( not bad , very interesting ,curry style ) , beef salad (the beef is soft,yum ) pad thai ( first time see green onion on pad Thai but good), and Tom yum ( excellent ) . Love . Will visit soon of course .
This place was great and our waitress was amazing! She was so nice. The food was really good and we enjoyed it very much.

I was so happy that The Original Thai BBQ (my favorite Thai restaurant) has a sister company closer to my place, so of course I had to try it out.  My family ordered: Tom Kha soup, combination Pad Thai, Beef Panang, & BBQ Spare Ribs, Mango & Sweet Sticky Rice, & Fried Banana (ala mode)  PROS: * Free refills on the Thai Tea... And they even refill it for you without asking them. That's a major plus! * Tom Kha soup, Pad Thai, and BBQ spare ribs tastes very similar (and even exactly) to the ones at Thai BBQ * Mango & Sweet Sticky Rice was delicious! * Serving size is reasonable & sufficient * Their lunch menu prices are awesome! $6.95 - $7.95, you can't beat that. Although the meat would be less than from the dinner menu, the lunch menu includes rice, soup, and an egg roll * The owners were super nice & friendly * Cute decor inside  [CONS]  * Unfortunately, their Panang was just okay. That was a major bummer since that's my favorite dish. It wasn't as creamy & sweet. However, the owner said that next time we order Panang, we can request for it to be more creamy & sweet (and even mention for it to taste like the one at Thai BBQ). So, I'll give it another shot the next time I eat here * Fried Banana had too much coconut on the outside. My sisters love coconut, but even they said the coconut pieces were overwhelming.. On the plus side, the vanilla bean ice cream it came with was yummy  Overall, it was good & convenient location.
I eat here once or twice a week. This is partially because I hate cooking, but mostly because their food is so good. It's also really reasonably priced.

Yes yes and yes! Coconut soup one of the best out there! No need for medium spice mild is just right! I fell in love with this soup in charleston sc and finally found a thai place who makes it just as amazing! Clean, great service and great food all around!!!

Wow, such an amazing experience. Ordered Red Curry with coconut rice, Fried Calamari & Yum-Woon-Sen! Wow, the food is amazing!! It was a little busy when we got in, but the wait was worth it. Took about 10 mins after ordering to get our food. We will definitely be coming back again. My boyfriend & I love Thai food!

Ordered delivery and I must say, it's probably one of the best meals delivered to my place. The presentation was nice, the food was delicious. My sister and I enjoyed it. We ordered the Thai beef jerky, summer rolls, papaya salad, and pineapple fried rice (next time will order spicy.) Would definitely dine here and order delivery again!

Look, food was excellent. But the service was even better! Server name was Ice, he pays attention & handles business! Great food & service, place gets my 5 stars for sure, 6 if it were possible.   Btw, we had the chili cashew chicken, garlic string bean shrimp, & pad Thai. Everything was delish. Thx Panna Thai & Ice!  -James
Best pad see ew in the area, I sub Asparagus for Chinese broccoli.  also the California garden rolls! Are so good I wish I can get this stuff in Chicago :( It doesn't  taste the same.

Good thai food and the service was very good and quick. We tried the lumch specials which seemed to range from $6 to $10 and came with the daily soup and eggroll. Also we tried the golden cups as an appetizer and they were amazing! If your in the mood for Thai food this would be a good place to try.
I'm actually impressed of this place, nice and classy decor, awesome service, food was great and at a fair price. I plan to be back here again :)

We had an awesom Thai place in Japan that we loved, Sawadee. This place is a great replacement now that we're back in LV. We had Wings of Angel, Yum Woon Sen Salad, Chicken Yellow Curry and Basil Noodle w/chicken. All was very good and large portions. Enough for us 2 to be full on dinner and probably 3 lunches worth left over. We enjoyed free refills on the Thai Ice tea too; I mean where else do you get that? All for about $42. So dinner and 3 lunches for 42 bucks. Super Yummy, lots of flavor, big portions, cheery staff and very reasonable prices, what more can you ask? Get down there!
Pleasantly surprised to see how good this place is. Everything I tried was delicious. Must have the pad Thai, spicy crab noodles, the fried rice, and deep fried duck. A hidden jewel in Las Vegas

It was really, really good. And really, really close to our place. Which is why they get...5 stars!   Came in toward the end of the night, party of 2. We were seated quick...the staff and Chef (see below) were great and attentive.  Ordered:  Yellow Curry Fettuccine Alfredo...I know! Fettuccine Alfredo in a Thai place?!? Thats what made me want to try it and it didnt disappoint. Though I had to order a side of steamed rice to help with the spice, cus no i didnt have an option of choosing a spice level. But, I would order it again.  Divine Scallops....4 scallops on the plate. God, they melted like butter in my mouth...but again. It was too spicy for my like. So I ate some rice with them. Lol it helps!   BBQ Chicken....it was about 3-4 pieces of chicken, comes with its own rice. What can I say? Its a classic. It was great.   For Dessert: We werent going to order any however the Chef happened to be taking a breather while we were having dinner and after a good 15-20 minute conversation about work and life, to our surprise he sent us some dessert, on the house! It was.....  Banana dipped in tempura and deep fried, on the plate came strawberry sauce and on the side a large scoop of fresh coconut ice cream. Wow it was delicious and next time ill order it.

I've been going to Panna Thai since it first opened and it's still my favorite Thai restaurant in the valley. I used to always eat at their first restaurant (Thai BBQ on Jones) when I was in high school and when they opened Panna my family would come here almost every other week for dinner since it was closer to home. I love their Thai Tea and I've yet to find any place that beats theirs. It's pretty sweet, but very refreshing and creamy. Their service is always great and their takeout business seems very lively.   Now for the food, I'll throw out a lot of recommendations but keep in mind I always eat in so I'm not sure how well things keep for delivery or takeout. For noodles, their Pad See-ew and Pad Thai are consistently delicious. I typically go for Beef Pad See-ew or Chicken Pad Thai. For curries, I almost always get a Beef Panang Curry because it's probably my favorite thing on the menu. You can adjust the spiciness to whatever you want too. If Panang isn't your style, I'd recommend the Green Curry with chicken. Other amazing things include: Herbal Fish Salad, which is a bunch of strips of crispy white fish with a unique vinaigrette on greens. Tom Kha soup with chicken, which is like a sour soup with coconut milk and mushrooms.   They have affordable lunch specials here too. I usually go for the Beef Sate (~$8) or the Garlic Short Ribs (~$7). The short ribs are packed with a lot of flavor in a garlic sauce and the beef sate is like three skewers of meat with good egg fried rice.  All in all, I've been to Panna a bunch of times and have never had a bad experience. They're very consistent and they make good Thai food as well as some specialty fusion dishes. It's a great place to go for large groups too. They serve beer and wine and have a TV if there's a certain game you need to watch. But seriously, get the Thai Tea.
I was a little surprised by my fried rice which was on the sweet side. I didn't really like it. Otherwise the curry was good.

Recently whenever I order delivery they don't cook the tofu. It used to be fried tofu and now it's just soft and has no flavor. I'm afraid to order delivery again since this has happened twice and it ruins the curry :(

I ordered delivery on Saturday night.  I ordered around 7:15PM.  My order confirmation said 45-60 minutes.  2 hours and 20 minutes later, after 2 calls to the restaurant to confirm if my order was coming or not, it finally arrived.   The food was good, I felt the portions were small compared to other Thai places I've ordered from.  I probably won't be ordering delivery from them again.
Went in for lunch. They have amazing Thai tea, but the food doesn't hold much spice. Good if your looking for something mild, tho.
The best Thai food I've ever tasted. Friendly attentive staff, service is top notch!

I love Thai food, so it's a comfort to me knowing that I have a solid option so close to where I live. My boyfriend and I have stable orders we always end up getting. We got here an hour before closing so it was empty. When we first ordered some water, the waiter forgot. We didn't get our water until we got our food, but I'll just give him the benefit of the doubt that it was because there were no other customers and they were ready to close.   Panang curry with beef: Very creamy. It had a lot of flavor and good amount of spicy. My bf was impressed because "it isn't broken and very smooth."  Pad se ew with tofu: I didn't realize that the tofu was fried and was cut into big chunks. I was't a huge fan of this, but my boyfriend loved it so I ended up just giving it to him. The noodles had a lot of flavor. The chinese broccoli could have been cooked a little longer.
Good food overall, nothing to write to mom about but maybe I need to give it a 2nd try one day down the road. Friendly staff.

I ordered some delivery food yesterday.  And I was supper disappointed. I order chicken pad thai. the order was so small that I thought it was just half of it. They also have bbq chicken dish with shrimp fried rice. there was no shrimp in that rice and wasn't good at all. don't  order from that place

Another great meal at our fav thai restaurant.  Had the mango chicken this time an it was awesome. It comes witj white rice an the flavor is great. Its sweet an just enough batter on the chicken is perfect. Great portions as well. They never disappoint.  Great food an great service.  Also had my favorites crab wanton an egg rolls. Thank for another great meal.

This is my most favorite restaurant in town. I would give this restaurant more than five stars if I could.   Every time I dine in here, I never get disappointed. The foods here are so awesome. Some items you cannot find at other places such as Yum-Eggplant, Spicy crab noodle, etc.   Also, don't skip the desserts here. The mango with sweet sticky rice here is amazing. The chef makes it into a cute heart shape, and its taste way better than its look. You must try it !!! While other thai restaurant cannot offer sweet mango during winter, I must applaud its management that they are so good at sourcing ingredients and keep its good quality of foods at high standard all year round.   On top of that, I like the service here. Servers are always attentive. I always get greeting every time I enter or leave the restaurant. My Thai Iced Tea drink always get refilled (for free.) They are very nice and friendly.   Lately, I've seen they have more varieties of wine to offer. If you are a wine lover who like to pair it with Thai foods, then this restaurant would be your top choice.
Amazing people- amazing food!  Take-out or dine-in, it is absolutely delicious.  Their curry, ribs, BBQ chicken, Pad Thai,  and any appetizer is well with it!

Was really happy to find a Thai place that delivers to me!! Yayyyyy! My prayers have been answered yummy Pad Thai delivered right to my door! It is not the best I have had but....it was very good that I ordered it a few times! I really liked the beef Pad Thai and the Crab Rangoon's were good too! Delivery is super quick and always fresh! Its convenient and good if your in the mood for some Thai! Service is always friendly.

We had it delivered to the house. The delivered almost 2 hours after the order, and the crab wonton they delivered were cold, and none of the food was hot. My pregnant wife luckily did not eat the cold crab.

This restaurant the food and the service are excellent. We considered this restaurant is five star. They have good parking. Inside the music is soft and wonderful to enjoy the food and to have a conversation.
So much better than Lotus! Bang Bang Shrimp and Spicy Crab Noodle are super yummy. Service was excellent and pretty quick too. Awesome lunch specials with good-size portions under $10.
Nice neighborhood Thai place. Good serving size for the Pad See Eww. Worth the price. My new Thai place to go!
Great food and service. Always consistent. Love the atmosphere and prices. Thai Tea and duck soup, delicious!!!
I shouldn't have come at 4pm and expect too much. I ordered the basil pork. Some pieces were warm, some pieces were cold. The spring roll was cold. Oh, well.

I ordered food from here and it was still so tasty when I got home.  I got pad z ew and chicken green curry. Both dishes were very good, especially the green curry. I have had super milky green curries at other places which luckily wasn't the case here. I loved it. Nice rich flavor they immediately reminded me of my time spent in Thailand.   I look forward to dining in and exploring the menu some more

Food is okay and everything takes forever. Appetizer took 20 mins to get here. If you have enough patience then it won't bother you that much. Just asked for my check 5 mins ago as we speak. Everybody works here is like in slow motion.

As I am reading the reviews here I am a little ticked off. I spent $ 60.00 for two here last night..  We Ate plenty.. I ordered the Thai Ice Tea and according to the reviews on yelp they give free refills on the Thai Ice Tea as long as you dine in..  I did not receive one offer for a refill on my Thai Ice Tea from any of the 2 or three servers that were handling our table. The food was good though. I would have given them 4 stars if the service was better.  I went back to this restaurant again and it was perfect. Plenty of Thai tea refills and great food. Service was excellent as well. The restaurant is decorated beautifully too. I will be back to Panna Thai.

I had a $25 Groupon about to expire, so we stopped here for dinner on the way to Town Square.  I had the Choo-Chee shrimp spiciness 3 out of 5.  My wife had the Garlic Garlic stir fry with chicken, 0 spiciness.  We had an order of fried egg rolls for a starter.  The meal was excellent.  I could have ordered a level 4 spiciness, but now I have an idea of their index of heat.  Andrea was thrilled with the amount of garlic with her chicken and the rich brown sauce with the chicken.  We ended the meal splitting the molten chocolate cake which was warmed.  I am really glad Groupon helped me find another good Thai restaurant and I know I'll be doing take out from here for the Garlic garlic chicken in the future.

I love this place.  The inside is beautiful,  ambient,  and very clean. It's never been overly busy (which is nice because it's quiet).  Service is always great.   Food is awesome and spices are always on par with what you request.  The spring rolls are to die for. Also,  the Thai iced coffee with milk is DELICIOUS!

Wow!  We drive out of our way to eat here when we are staying on the Strip. Best thai food that I've had in Nevada. Huge portions too.   The peanut sauce is made fresh to order and is the tastiest I have experienced.   The soup and fresh rolls are also good with evidence of  fresh cut veggies  Get the basil chicken medium spicy and you'll be good to go.  Service can be a pain during busy hours however.

Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (5 of 365)  I was pleasantly suprised by how flavorful and yummy everything we ordered was!  My friend and I came here over the weekend at around 3pm; so no one was in the restaurant.  We ordered: Pad See Ew Beef, Garlic Short Ribs, and Papaya Salad.  The salad was refreshing, the short ribs had a great crispy texture on it and wasn't too salty; just the right amount of garlic flavor, and the Pad See Ew was one of the best I've ever tasted!  It was full of flavor, had an abundance of egg which I love, and you get to choose whether you want american or Chinese broccoli.  Awesome!  The only downside was they didn't have any mango at the time we were there; and it's in season!  Not good.  I would have given it 5 stars if they had it!  But I'll be back for sure!

Date night with hubs.    Panna Thai is very cute inside.  Much nicer ambiance than your average Thai restaurant.    In addition, they have a selection of wine and beer.  Also, exceeded my expectations for a Thai place.  We had San Miguel.  Dark and tasty.  No cold glasses though. Boo.  Started with two apps: Wings of angel and royal duck.  The names are a bit whimsical.  The wings are stuffed with glass noodles, and ground pork then fried ultra light and crispy. Very good!  The royal duck was a really pretty presentation.  It was rolled in a tortilla/crepe thing and served with a way to sweet BBQish sauce.  We just thought it needed salt and spice.  Also, the duck was tough.   Ordered two entrees: Choo-chee shrimp and Pad see-ew noodles with beef.  The shrimp were in a flavorful spicy red curry sauce with keffir leaves, served with rice.  They were good.  The noodles were chow- fun esque.  We ordered a 6 for the spice and they were HOT! We were sweatin' but it hurts so good!  The portions were generous and the prices fair.  We had 3 beers, 2 apps, and 2 entrees....bill was $55.  A lovely dinner. We will go again for sure.

Panna Thai is my  favorite Thai restaurant in Southwest Vegas. Been to many of them in China Town and this one ranks right up there for quality of food and prices not too bad. Like it better than the popular and pricier Archie's Bistro. Panna Thai's atmosphere  is very nice and service is very good. Understanding English is a little bit of an issue with one or two of the servers but they try hard and are very nice.   Only small gripes is that the appetizer comes out at same time, or even later than the main course. Only pick from mild, medium and hot. Medium not very spicy.   On the dinner receipt, if u spend enough they print a 20% off coupon for next dinner. It expires in 30 days and don't be a day late though, they won't take it...
Delivery took over an hour, the food was cold and low quality. Fried rice tasted like cardboard. Very disappointed

I had Tuna tata and golden cup for appetizer it was really good. And I had Pink noodle soup for main course. I told the server that I wanted spicy less sweet and I got exactly what I requested.  Also excellent service!!!
Only been here a couple of times, but it is new favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. Very reasonably priced. Favorite dished Shrimp Pad Thai and Garlic Eggplant with Fried Tofu
First time here, this place is very nice, nice atmosphere, ambiance plus the food was delicious. This place is right around the corner from our home we will definitely be back...

While I was a bit surprised that Pad Thai is not on the lunch special menu it is easily one of my favorite places to go for lunch.  Service is generally fast enough for an hour lunch and the $8 specials have decent variety.  My fav is the yellow curry, though everything I have tried has been tasty.  Also, I love the decor.

I dream about their Pad Woon Sen, that is their silver noodle dish with shrimp, pork, vermicelli, veges and sauce. Let me tell you about the sauce, it's a great balance of sweet, salty, sour and spicy which are the basis for most Thai dishes.   Their tea is also really good quality Jasmine tea bags. I liked it so much, I took a picture so I can look for the brand and but it for home.   Service is good because they kept filling out water and removed our dishes when needed.
My new favorite Thai place in Las Vegas. I got the Basil Chicken Chow Mein spicy, it was amazingly good. The wife ate the Mango sticky rice and loved it. We will definitely be back!

Not impressed with their spice level at all. I got a 5 for extra spicy and it was nearly even a kick. The Pad Thai was soggy and not good flavor sadly. The chicken salad was great along with the Chai Tea. I was hoping to have another fave Thai place but I'll be sticking to my #1 fave.

This is a regular for us for my son. We're near this location twice a week and he gets the same thing - Pad See Ew. I've also tried the tofu with garlic eggplant. Both of these we highly recommend. My son gets it medium spicy and it's good. The one time we ordered green beans, we were disappointed because it wasn't what we're used to. It tasted more like a soy gravy over green beans than a Thai green bean.  It's definitely good.
Panama is our go-to Friday night delivery. The food is always excellent and the drivers are friendly, and personable!

I've been coming to this restaurant for many years but the manager is so rude! We are having a baptismal event and hoping they can accommodate us but this manager is just manager is just plain rude & doesn't want to accommodate our party. We are giving him business but he was flat out rude & inconsiderate of people canceling on us. So disappointed

LOVE PANNA THAI.  I used to Live in Thailand and sometimes feel like a Thai food snob.  This is authentic--they actually speak Thai there.  They are truly Thai style restauranteurs and people.  The beef salad is delicious if you want something healthy.  Best Thom Kar ever!!  My BFs mom from Texas still talks about it.  The staples are great Panang, veggies, Thom Yum, everything really.  The decor inside is warm but modern.  Often we just get it delivered.  I would def recommend.

BEST Thai place. I frequent here or order to go quite often. Everything is always delicious and great service! The bbq spare ribs are the best I've had! I also love their delightful noodle, yellow curry, Tom Kai, and the golden cup appetizer! Also, they do free refills on Thai tea (that's a winner for me & keeps me always coming back!) and delicious sweet rice all year round! Always love the friendliness here and how fast they are!

I order postmates delivery from this place all the time. They give very generous portions, and the food always comes delicious. There's these shrimp dumplings that are really good.
