I could eat those all night. I also recommend getting the pad se ew with beef. It has a little bit of that char smokey flavor and the noodles are soft.   The prices seem pretty reasonable as well. Delivery is always more expensive and it was still under $80 to feed 6 adults.

I usually order and take the food home but today I decided to eat in the restaurant. The food has always been delicious but what made me write this review was the service I received. Everyone, from my waitress to the host was kind and attentive and made everything even more enjoyable. This is my favorite Thai food restaurant.
Very very good Pad Thai. Was very juicy and tasteful. Packed a lot of flavor.  The Tom Yum Kha was also very tasteful. It's essentially a hybrid of Tum yum soup and yellow curry.

I'm not sure why I never tried Panna Thai until now but I'm glad I did. It was a rainy week this week in Vegas and after cooking something at home and it not turning out just right I called Panna.   I ordered the crab wontons and pork pad see ew. I have been on a pork kick lately so that was the reason instead of going traditional with the beef. I was really eager to try the crab wontons as I saw that it was made with real crab. Sure enough it was as delish as other Yelpers had said it was and I even told my husband he HAD to try it. The consensus in our household was that it was pretty great. The pork pad see ew was good but I'm a carbs person. The pork to noodle ratio was about 2:1 so I felt like I was eating a lot of meat. Overall the flavor was good I just didn't like the overbearing meat but if you are a meat eater than this is definitely for you. I have to say I felt like I did get my money's worth in regards to both items.   The next day I wanted to try the BBQ pork noodles. It's BBQ pork noodle soup and I really really really enjoyed the pork. It was tender and there was plenty (which in this case I appreciated). Yes, I know I'm picky but I felt that the pork to egg noodle ratio was just perfect. I also ordered the spicy basil pork. Now that dish was just ok...definitely not my favorite place to order it from as I missed the cucumbers that do come with it at other Thai places. Overall, I def enjoyed this place. They do get busy though because the second night even though we ordered it at 7:30 pm it still was a 20-30 minute pick up time. They deliver too if you really need some Thai food.

came in here for dinner tonight on a recommendation from a friend that was craving larb.  it was clean, service was friendly.  ordered the larb (obviously), i had the basil flat noodles, and my friend had the duck soup.  the food was surprisingly very good and satisfying.  the larb was flavorful and even though we got the spiciness of medium it definitely had a kick.  i had the basil noodle with squid with medium spicy and it definitely had some kick to it.  a great thing about this place is free refills with their thai iced tea.  overall it's a good place.  only downside is this place is a bit pricier than thai places nearby (aka thai noodle house) but the ambiance is more "date night" type rather than quick bite to eat stops.  you can't go wrong with trying this place.  you're gonna get a good meal especially if you live on this side of town and lotus of siam is a bit of a drive.

Did I seriously not write a review on this place yet?   I've frequented MANY thai places (all in LA except for Lotus of Siam), and this place is pretty dang good.   LArb- 5 star. THe best I've had. Maybe they had a good day, I dunno, but it had a great amount of lime and cilantro with a serious kick. DELICIOSO!  Drunken Noodle- 5 star. AKA Pad Kee Mao.  SOOOO GOOOOOOD. LOVE.   Panang curry- 2.5 star.  Meh, I'd skip this. It was heavy on the cream and tasted a bit too americanized for my taste.   In general the food here is a bit more americanized than authentic thai. I like the decor, and the prices are awesome.   My fave here so far is the THAI ICED TEA.   I can really taste the black tea in there instead of the one's that are just diluted with a bunch of cream in it. And free refills? Too good to be true. That's unheard of in L.A.    Def Try.

Worst Thai food I've ever had I ordered scallop asparagus and shiitake I couldn't have more than 2 bites... It was tasteless and after I had the first bite there was a paste of oil on the top of the inside of my mouth it was so gross!! Also the scallops were like rubber so chewy!!.. I also ordered basil noodle with beef it had no flavor the only thing that was decent was the BBQ chicken from the grilled section... And I asked to get some peanut sauce for it which I didn't get.... I'm never coming back!!

The whole point of ordering online is for it to be convenient . What is the point of putting in special directions IF YOU DON'T READ THEM??? On top of the food taking over the 20 minutes they said it was going to take they threw onions all over my husbands food. He is allergic to onions can't eat them. I specifically wrote that in the special instructions . It's just upsetting because I really like the food but my husband is beyond livid .. so no more Panna Thai.  READ YOUR ONLINE ORDERS !!!
Always delicious to eat the Spicy Ground Chicken Basil lunch special! For dessert, I got the mango sticky rice! Thank you so much!

Been here several times and I absolutely LOVE the lunch special! The best part about it is that it's one of the rare places you can find a lunch special on a Sunday afternoon. My fiancé and I often come here after church.   It's super reasonably priced for the beef sate and bbq chicken meals (what we normally get). It's only $7.95!   Their lunch special menu is front and back, so there's many options. I definitely recommend this place.
This is my favorite Thai restaurant! Best Thai food ever ! Highly recommended . The fried rice is really good .

Really good food, friendly staff. Pad Thai was good med. wasnt spicy enough for me always afraid to ask for hot then its to hot at some places. I like the number system 1-10 better.... the glass noodle dish was nice too. Wings of an angel dish is a great ome for kids that like nuggets and such. Sate was pretty good seasoned well the peanut sauce was a little greasy. All in all great experience, we will be back for sure.

The food was ok. Got vegetable spring rolls, fried tofu, pineapple fried rice. It was nothing to write home about.   Ambience was nice enough and clean. The bathroom was a little dirty and you could tell it needed to be cleaned.   Where they really lost the stars was service. There was only three other parties in the joint and yet it felt like our servers were nowhere to be seen. I had some trouble understanding the waiter through his thick accent. They were very nice and friendly but I had to wait a while to have t water refilled and never got a refill on my ice tea.  I'm sure there are better Thai restaurants out here in the valley.

I have been going to this place for the past 4 years and they do not disappoint me. This is my go to thai restaurant. Great ambiance and great service. Good pricing as well.... i love their refillable thai tea, beef panang, glass noodles, tom yum soup, beef spare ribs, yellow chicken (?) and fried tofu! Everytime i have visitors in town, i always bring them here because this restaurant delivers good food and service.

I heard that this is the sister restaurant of my favorite Thai BBQ on Jones so I've bookmarked this place and looked forward to going here ever since. It took me a year until I finally paid this place a visit. All thanks to Restaurant.com certificate, I went here with my sweetheart for dinner. We had to order a lot though just to uphold the certificate. My bf got the Pineapple Curry with beef and I got their Masaman curry with chicken. For our appetizer, we opted for their chicken/beef sa-te (satay?) and for the first time ever, we also got dessert: fried banana (coated with coconut flakes and deep fried). All of them tasted good, really good. The service was attentive and friendly. The decor was nice and intimate. The only thing that bothered me was their very see-through glass wall. Whenever a car would pass by or park right in front, their lights would blind the ones inside. They need to tint it a little. At the end of our meal, we could barely breathe since we ate more than usual. I was impressed by their fried banana since I'm very picky with both banana and coconut, so I was surprised at how I did not hate it at all. I just bought another Restaurant.com gift certificate. It must mean I really like this place =)

I have been here a couple of time and really like to try more. The atmosphere was nice, clean, good decorated 5/5. Service was great! 5/5. Menu is amazing having pictures so help me to picture the food would like like 5/5. There is interesting appertizers. I had shrimp cake and it was good! 4/5. Groud pork Basil was great 4/5 Tom ka kai has 2 sides small and big which the small one is big enough for 2-3, taste was great, not disappointed 5/5. BBQ pork ribs fried rice is my favorite for lunch, very big, delicious and reasonable price!  5/5. Some are a little pricey if comparing with other restaurants 3/5.  But I would come back and try again!

Favorite Thai restaurant on the SW side of town! Cozy atmosphere for groups of 2-6 people / extensive menu / cheap prices (most dishes start at $8.95) / and great service.  TIPS: If you usually order pad thai, opt for the Spicy Crab Noodle instead (stir-fried rice noodle with crab, egg, and green onion). If you usually order yellow curry, opt for the Panang Curry instead. I've tried the yellow curry before and it's too thin for my liking. The Panang Curry is just like yellow, but thicker and more flavorful.

I'm not the type to review based on service...   Basil Noodles: super fresh vegetables in the mix and they allow you to pick the kind of noodle (thick or thin) you want   Pad See Ew: perfect balance of sauce, broccoli and chicken. They allow you to pick between regular and Chinese broccoli   They have the option to make anything spicy which I loved.   Service: friendly and attentive- confused me order with someone else's twice... But food was so good it doesn't affect the rating.

I am not very adventerous with my Thai choices, and like mine Americanized, so no complaints there.  Beef Sa-Tay = So good.  Sweet, tender, with crispy grill marks.  The crispy burned pieces on meat makes me so happy.   Pepper Beef = Tender and a mild spice. My boyfriend likes this dish, but I am not fan of red/green peppers, so I just sneak a bite or two of just the meat. Pad Thai = Sweeter than other places, but always tasty. Pineapple Fried Rice = Comes with both Shrimp and Chicken which I like. I often ask for it to have a bit extra spice, but I think I like it better original.  There was a two large parties in there tonight, so the staff was busy with them - but we didn't feel abandoned.  I do have to say the ribs the table next to me ordered, looked delicious and might be the next thing I order!

I'm so in love with this menu!  MUST MUST TRY THE DUCK ROLL!!! Even if u don't like sushi - don't be fooled by its deceiving look of it- it's NOT sushi but Man is it AmaZeballs! Everything I've ordered both times has been fantastic & gets here quickly - friendly delivery drivers This place is s real stand out amongst the many Thai places available in vegas - LOVE IT!!!

Came here on a visit to Vegas. We were all craving thai food and went off reviews closest to our friends house.   This place had pretty good food. Pad thai was really good and the rice as well. Papaya salad was fresh and refreshing.   I just wish the green curry and pad see ew were a little bit more sweet. But otherwise, good (takeout) thai food. Would definitely go back. Service was very good too.
It's bomb as Fuck can't even lie I have only ordered and delivered it to my house but spring rolls are bomb too
Excellent food! Everything was delicious. The food was very light and had the right amount of spice.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is welcoming and relaxing, the service is friendly and the food is delicious. It's hard to stray from the curry or pad Thai since they're my favorites, but any time I've tried something new it was great.

We went for dinner a few weeks ago using a City Coups coupon for 1/2 off entree with purchase of an entree.    We ordered the  Pumpkin Shrimp Curry and the Mushroom and Broccoli with Pork. The shrimp had the tails on in the curry.  The broccoli was crisp and cooked perfectly.  The brown sauce was flavorful.  I would order both entrees again.  We will be back.

I can't believe that it's been over 7 years since we've been to this restaurant! It's not close to home, and I forgot about it until it was spotlighted in the LVRJ recently.  An hour before closing, we were the only ones there. (Two women showed up a bit later.) They were already doing some cleaning up, which may account for the very bright lights that weren't in evidence on previous visits.  Surprisingly, there were two Rieslings available by the glass. Our adorable server, Fon, couldn't tell me how the domestic or German offerings differed in terms of dryness, so she offered to bring a sample. She returned with a tray of four tiny sake cups, for both of us to taste the two wines. My husband was a little embarrassed, because he wasn't planning on drinking anything, but the wines were already poured. Very elegant presentation!  We ordered the grilled veggies as an appetizer. The zucchini and eggplant were wrapped with a wide slice of red pepper and topped with a drizzle of lime-infused oil. Delicious.  For our main courses, we chose Massaman Lamb Curry and Mango Tango Salmon. I made sure to say that I wanted the salmon cooked medium. Though her English was very limited, Fon repeated our order verbatim. While the curry was very good (though not the best ever), with lean lamb, as we requested, the salmon dish was a huge disappointment. It looked beautiful, with lots of basil, cashews, some mango, and a few flecks of red pepper. But not only was the salmon a tiny portion, it was thin, with one end not more than a millimeter in thickness. You can't possibly cook it medium when it's that thin. It was so dry and overcooked that we had no choice but to send it back. In its place, we ordered the Thai Pepper Steak.   While we waited for our replacement, Fon brought us a couple of complimentary cream cheese wontons. It's something that I would never order, since I try to avoid fried foods, but they were fabulous, and it was a really classy thing to do.  The beef dish was very good, with nicely tenderized beef, though not as exotic or spicy as I would have liked. While it was well-executed, it's probably my fault for not choosing something more adventurous.  Overall, we enjoyed our dinner at Panna Thai - with kudos to our server for making things right!

The restaurant has a nice ambiance and you did not feel like you were too close to other diners. My party of 4 was quickly seated and our server promptly brought our drinks. I had a vanilla chai tea and it was amazing! I am a huge tea fan and I really could have knocked back 2 before my meal arrived. For my appetizer, I ordered the summer rolls and they were delicious. I absolutely love the taste of mint with the tangy peanut sauce. My main course consisted of the yellow curry with potatoes, coconut milk, and tofu. The curry had great flavor and even though I ordered it spicy, the peppers were not overbearing. If you are not really into spice, you can order no spice.   The only slight negative was our server appeared to be working a large amount of tables by herself, so she was rushing and some of the plates had a rough "landing" on our table. It was no big deal and other than that, it was a positive experience.

I normally get crab fried rice or spicy crab noodles, always awesome, food and service here is great, if your looking for Thai food definitely come to this place, like I said food is awesome. They're restaurant is very clean also, all the people that I have had or talked to here have been nice also.

Found this place via Yelp because I was craving some spice.  I had ordered my food ahead of time for quick pick up.    I decided to order the garlic short ribs since this dish had been one of the recommended as I read through the reviews.  When I arrived they greeted me with big smiles and since my order was not quite ready, they pointed me to have a seat in the mean time.  The atmosphere is like your typical Thai restaurant, big furniture and large art.    When I got my order I quickly took it back to my office to enjoy.  I decided to order more salad then having rice.  I think I jipped myself because there was not that much salad.  However, there was plenty of garlic short ribs.  I give it an A-OK rating because there were some pieces that were rather dry.  I thought it was going to be full pieces of short rib, but it was cubes.  So I didn't quite have what I thought I would of gotten.  The taste is good, but warning that you will be burping that garlic all day long.  LOL.    I probably will return to try out some other dishes.  Seems to be a hit or miss and I'll be determined to find that special dish.  Every place has a special dish.

I'm reviewing solely on their delivery service (and food). I've ordered from here through Eat24 a couple of times and both times they have been on schedule. My recent order included Panang Curry, Steamed Dumplings, and Tasty Ginger (with shrimp).  The curry was delicious. I ordered a mild but it came with a kick. Not sure if they got it wrong, or my tolerance is very low. It was creamy and very coconutty. The chicken was also nice and tender. I didn't really care for the dumplings. They were good, but they had an off taste that I couldn't quite figure out. The dipping sauce that came with the dumplings was a bit too strong in flavor. The tasty ginger with shrimp was my favorite. It had just the right amount of ginger and spices and the shrimp (peeled) was perfectly cooked. Their Thai tea is also very good (pretty generous with the cream, which I like).  If you're ordering through Yelp Eat24, the entrees come with rice. The menu doesn't state that. I wish I knew beforehand because I ordered 2 servings of rice and it came with 4.

Delivery took over 45 minutes but the online ordering was pretty easy and painless.  Beef Salad was the best item in my order.  As another reviewer mentioned, the beef was nicely smokey, and it was okay quality meat, not gristly.  The salad is mostly meat, with light lettuce and some tomatoes and cucumbers.  The dressing is mostly lime juice, which I like.  A good low calorie fairly-healthy choice.  I would have liked cucumber slices that were a bit larger.  Chicken Fried Rice was kind of weird, there were clumps that were really sweet (maybe it was sweetened eggs?), but mostly it was really bizarrely bland.  Tons of onions.  Not much chicken or tomatoes.  I would not get this again, myself.  Green Milk Boba was overpriced, the cup was small styrofoam (12-16oz if there wasn't any ice), 50% ice at least, and barely any boba ($1 upcharge).  The boba were super overcooked to the point they had melted down small.  For $4.50 I could have a monster-size boba somewhere else.  This place is not cheap, but still one of the better delivery options in this neighborhood.  Maybe I'll enjoy some of their other dishes more.

We got two lunch pad thai's for pick up and all the food stayed warm which was awesome! The salad was the only downfall. It was just a handful of lettuce with some sesame seeds and carrots. Other than that though, the pad Thai was great and a good amount for the price!

Our family of 5 went for a special occasion on a Tuesday night after deciding we were in the mood for thai food and reading several reviews off yelp.   I don't think I've ever been more disappointed in other reviews as I was that night.   Entering, this place was empty...like uncomfortable empty. There was another couple with a child, and even though the atmosphere was great (the ambiance earned them the two stars!) it was just too empty for 9pm at night.   We order several dishes including papaya salad, pad see eu, pineapple curry, masaman curry, and pineapple rice (which was actually never brought out to us, but after tasting some of the other stuff, we were pretty ecstatic that we wouldn't have to waste more of our money). We also ordered thai tea (one with boba) - which was decent and we weren't charged for refills (which is a plus compared to other places). However, the boba was rock hard -- this might be because it was late at night and they just wanted to get rid of leftovers, but that's not OK at all.   Out of all the dishes, I ONLY enjoyed the papaya salad and the pad see eu. I felt as if the pineapple curry and the masaman curry were the EXACT same - the only difference was that the pineapple curry had pineapple. The curry was also too watered down.   All in all, the atmosphere is what's given them my two stars. Service was also on par, no one was rude.   However, I noticed that a tip was added on to my initial check. So beware of that.   I'll be trying out plenty of other thai places before I give this place a second chance.

Food is delicious here. Been coming for years, only downside is you can tell that sometimes the proteins or coconuts have gotten a little old. Not bad, but not really fresh either. We were here New Year's Eve and we waited almost a full hour for one of our dishes, they must've forgot with all the takeout going out the door. Always really nice people though.

BS ++  The place is cute and a little modernized.  However it's chilly inside.  And I am not talking about  the spice in the food either.  So if you visit bring your sweater.  The waitress was hard to understand but we got our orders in.  We requested to put no salt in the food because my father-in-law was sensitive to it.  The  choices are typical but the presentation for the food was fancy.  The food came out one at a time (15 minutes wait) but it was still salty!! I  did like the appetizer.  We ordered all seafood dishes except for the bbq chicken.  We also ordered coconut  ice cream for dessert.  The waitress said  it was for one person but it's huge! Also,  if you are planning to come here after the gym make sure it's not ARM DAY!  They must have the heaviest teapots.  It weighed as much as a baby elephant!     Overall it was a good experience with lots of laughs.  I recommend bringing a date here.  It was nice and clean.  Food is GOOD and HUGE PORTIONS (spicy) Selection was ON POINT and NOT TOO OVERWHELMING Restrooms are CLEAN and got COOL RUSTIC LIGHTS Tables FANCY and RUSTIC Table wait time PLACE WAS EMPTY Room temperature was on the chilly side Customer service is GREAT (If I can understand most of it) Ambiance FANCY Kitchen SUPER CLEAN Parking lot was big but shared with  a lot of restaurants.  * Boomsauce scale. BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended. BS = it's just O.K. (experience) BS+ = Yo! I like this place. BS++= That's Whoa! This place good. BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

My to go spot for thai food! When im craving some good thai food, this is the place to go. The flavors are always consistent unlike other thai places.   My recent order pad see ew, asparagus with beef, and bbq ribs.  The Pad see ew uses large egg noodles. Very soft. More sou sauce based unlike the pad thai. But very delicious. They offer choices between regular broccoli or the chinese broccoli for the dish.   Asparagus and beef stir fry. It was seasoned perfectly. Not too salty, asparagus had a crisp to each bite and not overly cooked.   Bbq ribs. Gives you 3 large ribs marinated with a soy sauce asian bbq sauce. It was great as well. It came with a sweet and sour dipping sauce and fried rice with it as well. The meat was very tender, and came right off the bones. It's a musy try!   Overall, a great thai restaurant. You can never go wrong here!
Order Crispy Tufo, Salmon Delight, & Basil Fried rice with shrimp To go. As usual everything is good. Highly recommend for quick Thai food fix.
Tom Kha soup was delicious!!!  Nice ambiance and decor; however, the music was a bit too loud. Will definitely come back.

Great food and service! My kids and husband loved their food and we will certainly go back since it KS some of the best thai food we have had!!! Our server (Apple) was great and cordial. Can't go wrong here!!

The atmosphere at this restaurant is a bit more upscale than most Thai restaurants while menu prices are more than reasonable given the quality of the food.  On this evening over  1/2 the restaurant was set up for a large party, but our karma was good as we were able to order before most of the guests arrived. We began with yum-wood-sen, glass noodles with ground meat and shrimp with Thai spice and lime juice on lettuce.  For entrees we shared orders of scallop tamarind and spicy eggplant.  All three dishes made our taste buds jump for joy.  Our bill came in a few cents short of the minimum purchase requirement so I had to order a soda for takeout.
This place always forget one item but they return in less than 15 min and with an extra something. So I love them and they still get 5 stars. We always get the sticky rice and beef jerky! Delicious!

I didn't even want to give ONE star.. But it's the only way I can write a review and warn you guys about this place..   They won't greet you until after 10 minutes of staring at you like you have a head growing out of your shoulder. We sat down, waited for anybody to even come by and ask if we needed any drinks. So I tried to look by the servers and get their attention and they did look at me, but kept doing whatever they were doing which was nothing at all. It wasn't even that busy, maybe 5 tables and 3 servers. It's sad because I actually really like their food also my guy and I live right down the street so it was convenient for us, but man the service just straight sucks here. I'm a server as well so I know how these things work. I couldn't imagine doing this to anybody.   The food is great we always love coming here, or did anyway. However this happens almost every single time.. We just kept giving them the benefit of the doubt and chance after chance.. Even the people next to us, just 2 people, warned us how they've been waiting almost an hour for their food.. That's absurd.   We left and went to Archis Thai Bistro on Rainbow & 215. Always great service and we were in and out of there in less than 30 minutes.

sooooo good! The crab wontons are delicious and I usually get the spicy crab noodles. The portions are HUGE and everything is cooked fresh and hot. I only give it 4 stars because the staff isn't always very nice. Definitely a great take out place :)

Lots of excellent Thai food restaurants in Vegas, thankfully. The food here is good but the service really bad compared to other Thai restaurants in the area. They charge a lot for delivery and for extra additions to their rather bare dishes. They were extremely rude to my wife on the phone with our last order and hung up on her after getting our order wrong.   A few times I've gone in to pick up orders with a massive queue of other disgruntled take out customers waiting for their food for over 45 minutes. And they expect you to say sorry for being upset with them! I rarely ever leave negative reviews but this is a classic example of the mixed bag of service you get in the city which should take customer service more seriously since it's the only industry keeping the city afloat.

Great Thai food. I love pineapple fried rice and this place was great.  The garlic stir fry was flavorful and spicy just how I like it. The food was hot and came earlier then the estimate delivery time. I will definitely order from here again maybe dine in next time.

By far my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas I eat here at least once a week! The crab Ragu own is amazing and the papaya salad is probably my favorite thing on the menu! I love that they have whole coconuts and of course that they deliver!

Whether you eat in or order take out, you can't go wrong here. Plentiful portions and well seasoned.  As a vegan, there are plenty of options for me. I've been here a couple of times and they are always consistent with food quality. You won't be disappointed. Heck, they even deliver! What could be better than that?

This place has really great yellow curry. Tom yum was not the greatest I've ever had. The vegetable spring rolls were amazing and fresh. Thai tea was good too. The ambiance in this place was great. It is a great Thai restaurant not in the strip area.

Let me start out by saying, the food here is really good. The service is terrible. The first time I ordered I had it delivered. The delivery time I was given was 30 minutes. The food showed up an hour later and the driver forgot the Thai ice tea. The driver told me they would adjust the bill and credit my card back. That never happened. Because the food is so good I decided to give them another chance, bad idea. This time I decided to pick up the food so 1 I wouldn't have to wait as long and 2 they couldn't forget anything this time. Wrong again! Ordered online and paid for it. The time given was 10-35 minutes. 20 minutes after I ordered I got a call telling me it would be an hour at best. Really an hour?!?! So I said sure it was already paid for and I figured if I cancelled it now I wouldn't get my money back. 10 minutes after the first call I get another call confirming my order. Then a third call asking how I wanted my tofu cooked when I had already told them how I wanted it cooked when I ordered and then again in the first call. I feel like I've given this place a chance and they have failed. If they could get the service together this would be a 5 star review.

Excellent food and great service. We had a company Christmas party at the restaurant with more than 30 people. The food came out on time with no delayed, presentation is really nice and taste good on all dishes. The service is also excellent, very friendly and attentive. I would recommend to reserved your table 2-3 weeks in advance for the party as they can get really busy. The item that I would recommend is Sa-tay, pad thai, pepper steak, spicy green curry, and the BBQ. I will go to Panna Thai every time I think of Thai food.

Finally tried somewhere different than the usual few restaurants I usually go to in Summerlin. Driving way out to the southwest to try a new restaurant was a big adventure for me :)  Boy, was it worth it.  I go to Archi's very frequently, and I still love that place, but the Tom-Yum soup at Panna Thai was mind blowing.  This is the first time I've ever used that expression, BTW--"mind blowing."  Also loved the vegetable egg rolls and pad thai w/ tofu.  Service was top-notch.  Interior of restaurant was lovely.  I already can't wait to go again.

I ordered a red curry chicken, and chicken chow mein. Unfortunately curry was the worst I ever had. Bamboo shoots were under cooked, therefore each time I put one in my mouth after chewing a few times I had to take it out. And the chicken was extremely overcooked. with chow mein, it was only so so, bit bland. I have eaten here couple of times before, never had a problem. I am assuming a new  cook maybe? Extra star is for the service, guys who work here are always very polite and quick.

Two stars for decent Thai food. But tonight will be the last time I order from Panna Thai.  Let me recap. On 12/28/15 I placed an order and it took 2 hours and 13 minutes to arrive. Because of this inconvenience, I was told I would receive a free order of pad Thai.  Tonight I said to my wife, "Oh hey I have a free order of pad Thai babe!" so I placed another order with them. The woman who took my order was able to see the note on my account immediately which was great. She took my order, and gave me my total and reiterated I was receiving the pad Thai for free. -Not once did she read my order back to me-. (You will see why this detail is important later)  The delivery was prompt this time, about 40 minutes as opposed to the atrocious amount of time it took on Monday. I ordered the following:  -Thai iced coffee -Chicken pad Thai (the freebie) -Beef Sa-te (my wife's fave) -Chicken basil rice   I received all of the above as well as 3 free egg rolls, which was nice. However, they gave me chicken sa-te instead of beef. Mind you this is my wife's favorite, and if I order sa-te it's going to be beef.  So I call just to let the restaurant know, thinking maybe this is something that was miscommunicated due to an error in their order placement system. I wasn't asking for a handout or anything. But instead the woman on the phone tells me that she was the one who took my order, and I definitely ordered chicken sa-te because she read my order back to me. "This is part of the rules." she says, so I must be crazy. My wife doesn't love the beef sa-te, and I must have ordered chicken. I responded to her telling her that it's not a big deal, I just wanted to let them know, yet she tells me I'm wrong and hangs up.  Needless to say, my family and I will be ordering from a different place when we get the craving for Thai in the future.  Thank you for the free egg rolls though, that would have been a very nice touch if things turned out differently.

I have been to Panna Thai a handful of times over the years. It's never busy, but it's never empty every time I have been.  It's simple to call & order pick-up, which would be ready in 15 min. However, I suggest to never order Thai Tea if it's pick-up. It's great when you dine-in & you can get unlimited refills, but as for pick-up, it's never as good. I'm going to assume that they make the Thai Tea when you call, which in time, will sit & be watered down by the time you pick-up. I also suggest to pass on adding boba. I never find it fresh.  Other than that, their food is good & their portion sizes are good. I have always liked all the food I tried. My go-to is the Spicy Crab Noodle, which is made with legit crab & large enough to share with another person. Panna Thai is a good option to eat at with a family & share different items on the menu. You can end your meal with a Mango Sticky Rice for dessert!
Great food great service!  Love the beef panang! So yummy!  Thai ice tea is very tasty too!  Will definitely be coming back

I order from this location occasionally. The food is OK, and the portion is usually generous. However, I give the restaurant only two stars based on my last two experiences with them. One time I ordered some lunch specials to go including a beef Pad Thai. When I started to eat I immediately noticed the beef was spoiled and tasted disgusting. It's not just not fresh it's literally spoiled. So I threw the entire box away. The second time I placed the order online for pickup at about 7:45 pm. When I arrived the restaurant at 8:10 they appeared to forget about my order. I waited in the lobby and expected my order to be ready in 10 mins as the restaurant was only 1/3 full. However, I waited until almost 9 PM! They gave me a free Thai tea for my wait and I guess that's why I hesitate to give them a 1 star.

I tried this place out 3 times, but only because I was working across the street.    1 Star Because the food is EXCELLENT - I tried there BBQ Rib lunch special and it was amazing.  There Egg Noodle Soup is also very very good.  The duck noodle soup is good also.  The food is not super high quality but they make it work.  1 Star Because the service is very good and nice.  They know every person that comes in by first name and provide a friendly atmosphere  1 Star Because the Thai Tea is very good.  Any that restaurant for me should have excellent Thai Tea.  The portion is a bit small but standard.  1 Star Because the parking is easy and the spot is big enough to fit everyone and you are seated immediately.  -1 Star due to the food taking a very long time.  A lunch is 1 hour standard for most people.  I work across the street and cannot get my food in time.  It takes at least 40 min for the food to come out and i made it back late to work.  every time.  I even left early to go eat at panna thai and i was still late.  One time, every single person in the restaurant did not have food.  Total: 3 Stars = Eat on weekends and nighttime if you are local.  Not a place to drive far to eat or if you are rushed on time.

This place has new owners and the food is now terrible. I don't know why people keep eating here there are so many good Thai restaurants around here... I guess people are just stupid, or they're all smokers who have killed their taste buds and can't tell the difference.  I used to go here all the time but now I will avoid it like the plague!

We had dinner for my cousins birthday last Friday and we had a great time! So many options for a meat free meal for Good Friday. Free refills on Thai iced tea was a added bonus. Great service from the ladies and even brought us a free dessert when they found out it was her birthday! Will definitely be returning!

Went on a Wednesday night for dinner and it was an excellent experience.  The service was outstanding, the waitress made sure the refills flowed and everything was taken care of.  The duck roll and scallop appetizers were great, the golden cups were just average.  The seafood soup was a bit bland, but I added hot peppers from the condiment tray.  Basil tuna was outstanding.  Great place for Thai food.

We visited Panna last night.  I was a little aprrehensive since the online coupons have brought us to pretty run down places.  The moment we walked into Panna, I was pleased.  The lighting was dining room  perfect, the colors and decor were chic and welcoming, no typical greasy smell associated with asian restaurants.  The food was very impressive too.  good quality and fresh seafood and veggies and flavorful ingredience...and very appetizing but not too over the top presentation. We ordered the saute shrimp and egglant dish that came on a sizzling plate.  all veggies and seafoods cooked to perfection.  the basil & garlic dish with pork was excellent.  Kids got Chicken Satay, Angel wings, steamed dumpling, Pad Thai and  Pad na...all were good.  Maybe only the steamed dumplings lost a little steam.  Service was impeccable.  We are bringing our employees back to the restaurant again...tonight!

The Yellow Curry that i ordered was AMAZING, very flavorful and just spicy enough to keep every bite interesting.  My only complaint is the amount of rice given... they only give 1 bowl of rice per order, and that is not nearly enough for an avid rice fan like me... (it also costs $1.50 for another small bowl)  Also tried the Fried Banana as  the dessert and the presentation was ELEGANT, the fried banana was coated in coconut and it tasted GOOD with the lemony type sauce it came with.  Great food and the price is definitely do-able.  Would go back there again simply for their Curry.

We were craving some Thai food but wanted to be "adventurous" and try something besides or usual neighborhood goto so I quickly browsed my bookmarked list and found Panna. I was hesitant at first because I heard their food was pretty Americanized but I'm glad we gave them a try. Called in and placed an order for pick up:  Chicken satay entrée: comes with 6 nicely sized skewers of seasoned chicken, fried rice, salad and peanut sauce. Really good and nicely priced at around $12 a great shareable dish!  Beef and asparagus: YUMMM the beef was so tender and the asparagus still had a nice crunch to it! Good brown sauce that was not too salty and MUSHROOMS!!! Mmmm  Chicken Pad Thai: Meh. This was not good.. The noodles were way too soft and overcooked... the dish overall was too sweet.   The 2 yummy dishes made us forget about the 1 meh dish.. Portion sizes and prices are good...We will definitely be back!  Hot Tip: Togo containers are the plastic reusable kinds... WoopWoop!

I was in Vegas for my anniversary and decided to try this place. Overall, I had a great experience here. The food was awesome! I was on a mission to find the best Thai Beef Salad and I think I found it here! The service was phenomenal.   If you ever go to Las Vegas and want to dine away from Strip, this is the place to go.
Food was bomb! Got the pad thai with chicken and panang curry! Free thai coffee and thai tea refills!

The lunch specials include a broad range for just about any taste preference.  Ground pork with basil & chili hit the spot with miso soup and a small salad.  The service team is polite, friendly and attentive.  As a newly arrived resident of the Las Vegas valley, Panna is the 'best' Thai restaurant I've tried so far.  With my office close by, my return is assured.

Another Thai restaurant experience - lunch specials are the way to go I tell you!  First off, Panna Thai Restaurant looks a bit more upscale than your average Thai joint, which I think reflects in the price as well.  We walked in to a relatively empty restaurant on a weekday.  As the waiter brought us to our table, he immediately asked if we had any coupons (before we even sat down).  We did not, but apparently they do have a lot floating around and are a bit restrictive about how they are used.  I think they are also on restaurant.com too.  Lunch specials are available everyday from 11 am to 4 pm.  They all include a fried wonton, fresh salad, steamed rice, and soup of the day.  (You can substitute fried rice or brown rice for $1 more.)    Started off with miso soup.  Interesting choice.   I went for the Yellow Curry Lunch Special with Tofu "Thai yellow curry and Thai herbs served with Jasmine rice." ($6.95).   Fried tofu and potatoes were the main components of my dish.  Raw bell peppers decorated the top.  I wished they cooked the veggies with the curry though.  The fried wonton had peas and carrots in it - a bit different than what you normally find inside one of those things.  The biggest problem I had was with the rice.  It was mushy - too much water in the cooker!  It's never a good sign when the rice gets messed up!   The Husband tried out their Garlic Short Ribs Lunch Special "Deep fried short ribs sauteed with garlic and black pepper sauce served with Jasmine rice." ($6.95)  It was a tasty dish and lots of flavor, but then again it's deep fried and it sounds like it would be tasty.  Overall, we found Panna Thai to be just an okay experience.  There are definitely a few other Thai restaurants in the neighborhood that has a foot up on selection, taste, and price.

Clean Place, kinda slow service but the food taste really good without doubt .. it HAS sweet scenery and beautiful paintings attach to the wall .. i always order through Eat24 and Lunch specials are really descent with the food size they serve .. i love this place

My family and I love this place. Always great service and great food. I usually order the shrimp pad Thai, hubby gets Tom kha spicy and we get the kids a chicken sa te meal to share!! Also recommend the Thai tea boba drink, really refreshing and delicious!! Today we got strawberries for dessert as compliment. Happy Valentine's Day

It's small, food is excellent! Polite courteous service.  Well... the Panang is still excellent, but the noodle dish was dry noodles with dry pork, tasteless and useless. They didn't add the chicken I paid extra for either.

Ordered pepper steak  from lunch special thai spicy. Disappointed .....no effort was made to cook it spicy at any level. I could have made the same meal w a Thai cookbook or DVD..Mediocre! Server offered to bring sauces to the rescue the meal but Thai is best cooked w spices. Service is their strength!
The pad thai was disappointing and steamed dumpling was not even hot.  The only saving grace was the mango sticky rice.  I won't be back.

I've been ordering here for the past 3 years. I've dined both in restaurant and ordered from YELP's Eat 24! The restaurant is simply beautiful and elegant. The staff here are always friendly and welcoming. It is very clean in here which is a +++. Their Thai tea here is freaking bomb. Not too sweet, not too bitter and watered down. I also love that this place is literally down the street from my house.  I definitely recommend their satay (chicken/beef), fried rice, duck rolls, summer rolls, pad thai, tom kha gai soup, sticky rice &mango and their egg rolls! The staff here know me by name because they deliver to my house so much LOL. Sorry guys! ;)  The food here is freaking phenomenal. Who doesn't like amazing quality, reasonably priced thai food?! It is always made in a timely manner and great presentation. I've never gotten a bad dish here which is a surprise.   Thanks Panna thai for taking all of my money, but keeping my tummy happy! 5/5 and customer for liiiife!

Ive only ordered delivery from this restaurant, never actually been inside... but twice now I've been very impressed!  Food is delicious!  And even the take out has good presentation. Portions are reasonable... not huge shareable size like many places. Some people may not like that. But I thought it was perfect. Warning... I ordered Spicy on my pad thai and it was REALLY spicy!  Lol. But I like things hot. The tuna taretare was really light with a unique tangy flavor that I loved. And the roasted vegetables were delicious, also served with a yummy tangy dressing. Will be ordering from here a lot!

Tried this place out because it was near our house and our favorite spot is across town. The service was great and the restaurant looked very clean.   The non-spicy pad Thai was a little spicy for my girlfriends taste but still tasted good.   The fried rice however had me sick all day the following day.   Looks like we will be sticking to our favorite spot across town.

I just stopped by for a quick lunch - OMG, what a treat! It's 3 o'clock in the afternoon so it's quiet with some excellent smooth soul-jazz; the people are sweet and kind, and the food is off the charts fabulous! I just had the lunch special but the two businessmen down the way from me had five large platters of amazing-looking stuff - there was no way they ate half of it, not because it wasn't good au contraire, but because it was just too much. I will definitely be back here!
Valentine made the experience really good I had a wonderful time and the food was phenomenal I would definitely come back with my family and friends

This is one of my absolute favorite neighborhood places for Thai food in Las Vegas. They have an amazing variety of spices in all of their dishes that really put them ahead of other options, and I am obsessed with their noodle based offerings including their massive ramen bowls, pad Thai and chow mien. (I know not on the adventurous side of Thai cuisine, but equally delicious!)   In addition to take away, the restaurant interior is modern and relaxed and makes for a great lunch or dinner spot. It's never super busy, which is great for a quick or long meal. The staff is friendly and have provided awesome service every time I drop in.  They also provide complimentary refills for their Thai iced tea AND Thai iced coffee. Have you ever had Thai iced tea or Thai iced coffee? They are the BOMB and rarely ever offered unlimited at restaurants. They also serve beer and wine, including Singha the greatest Thai beer to ever exist.   If you're in the area you absolutely must try this place.
Great food! Good service! Comfortable environment! Decided to go here via Yelp reviews. Bell was my waitress, she was very kind and pleasant. I'll definitely be back...
Since our dine in experience - we've order both to-go and delivery and have still yet to be disappointed - always on point!!  All of the curries and the crab fried rice are still our favorites!

Service and speed are the reason why I give this a 2 star. Always a wait with plenty of tables available. Got a to go order. Salmon curry had approximately 8 cubes of salmon about 1/8 inch. Very small box and curry spilled all into salad that was about 5 pieces and egg roll was soggy   Much to be desired for take out.

We've never had any problems dining in and the food is great... however, whatever you do, do not order take out! Waited 20mins just to be told they never got my order/my order was lost. And then got a call about 10-15mins later saying I can go pick up my order.

Good food, good ambience, and fabulous service for a good price. We got panang curry (delicious), Thai steak (okay, a little salty), and sticky rice with mangoes (super cute and tasty). The serving size is big, so I think we would have been fine with just the curry. Looking forward to bringing guests here. I definitely recommend this place.

I'm not a picky person. But this irritates me. I ordered a lunch special that comes with salad and an egg roll.  Well they stuffed the salad, egg roll and rice all in one side. I appreciate that they don't use Styrofoam containers.  But the egg roll and salad were super soggy. The food is tasty, but the soggy salad and egg roll sucked! I would appreciate my egg roll and salad being separated next time.

Very good Thai food!  I like the atmosphere here...it's very clean and friendly.  The food prices were also good, especially during lunch time!  Most plates were around $7.  On to the food!  Basil Noodle ($8.50): "Pad Kee Mao", Pork, Stir Fried Thick Rice Noodles, Chili Basil, Scrambled Egg, Bell Pepper and Onion. This was not bad...not very hot though for a 10/10. I also found the pork to be a little thick and tougher than I am used to at other Thai restaurants.  THIS is one the dishes I compare all other Thai restaurants in town...and this one wasn't very noteworthy :(  Chili Basil ($6.95): "Pad Ka Pao" in Lunch Portion, Ground up Chicken, Sauteed with Sweet Basil, Onion, Bell Pepper, Fresh Chili, and Jasmine Rice. This was a great version of the staple! The most spicy out of all the dishes...it was still far from a 10/10 though!  It was good though, and better than most out there!  Panang Curry in Lunch Portion : Coconut Milk, Curry Paste, Thai Herbs, and Jasmine Rice. This was a great version as well, with just the right amount of spices, flavor and heat! I love Panang curry...and they have a great one here!  Again, better than most I've had out here!  Pad Thai in Lunch Portion : Chicken, Stir Fried Rice Noodles, Scrambled Egg, Shallot, Bean Sprouts, and Tamarind Sauce. This was Grandpa's order...it was good! A bit sweet, but good overall!  I'd say it would be on par with the others I've tried.  Thai Iced Tea ($3)...unlimited refills! It was a good rendition as well, but you can't beat free refills...yeeeee!  Great choice for Thai food if you are in the area!  Pics :

Panna Thai has a lot of options from you to choose from but if you want cool food, horrible service and  INSECTS in your food this is the place to come too. I know mistakes are made and you can't always control what happens but this is my 4th time finding some type of insect in my food or my baby sisters food. Most of the time their slow, it's a 50/50 chance if the food will come out hot or cold, you never know what temperature your food will come out or what's in it.

This is one of the very few Thai restaurants that is very consistent with flavor and quality. Out of all the times we have been there whether it's taking out or dining in they have always surpassed our expectations. Here in Vegas we're pretty spoiled with our food choices because of the amount of restaurants within a 10 minute drive but this one in particular has made its rounds consistently in our top 10.

One of my fave Thai spots and super close too. Im always in for tom kha soup! Yummerz! Beef pad see ew is good, my husband's favorite. Crab rangoon and fried shrimp are not to be snobbed at. I love curry dish, i haven't tried the panang yet. Im not so impressed with massaman curry though. It lacks flavors maybe salt? Too souppy. I like my curry a little bit thick. And who can forget thai iced tea or coffee??? I love both. Plus its free refill!!! Free refill people! I usually get mango sweet rice. Too bad mango is not in season anymore.

my first visit using a restaurant.com coupon- the food was tasty and favor-ful, but I must agree the portions are a bit small.. The service was top snotch and attentive. I would go back, maybe try the lunch special, yummy...

The Best Thai food I've  had in Las Vegas so far. Service was great, servers were very nice and attentive. Everything we ordered was outstanding. Good ambience  with soft jazz music and candlelight , felt like fine dining experience but way less Expensive. Will definitely back and recommend everyone to try. The comlimentary fried banana desert from our server Apple,  was Awsome!!! Thank you everyone.

This place is great. Portions are really the only thing keeping them from my 5 stars. But the food is delicious. They make it fairly quickly, and the service is about what you expect for an asian restaurant :)

Ordered from here and was told it would be to my home within 45 mins...  An hour and a half later I got a call from the restaurant asking if they had the correct address, I informed them of the correct address and was told they would be to my home ASAP... 30 mins later I called the restaurant and was told a lie that they didn't know what to do with the food and was told another story by not only the manager but the original driver who contacted me.  I am so disappointed and will not order from them again nor will I recommend them at all.  They offered me a 5 dollar discount for my next order... Laughable since this order was almost 60.  Time to move on

My husband took me to Panna Thai last night for my birthday.  The restaurant  is clean, the staff is kind and accomodating, and the decor is lovely.  We brought our three children, ages 6, 5, and 2, to dinner with us and the staff was so great with them. As far as the food goes, I thought that it was delicious!  I ordered the yellow curry chicken (medium spicy), my husband ordered the peppered steak dish, and our kids shared the sweet and sour chicken (not the fried Chinese dish, this was fresh and pan seared) and the chicken chow mein noodles.  Everything was tasted absolutely wonderful!  My kids really loved the soup that they brought out before our entrees arrived.  The broth had so much flavor. I would highly recommend Panna Thai.  I know that we will definitely be going back again!

This is my third order for Panna Thai delivery, and every single time they have forgotten the cucumbers and pineapples for my simple Thai Salad. I don't understand - its clearly in the description. I don't just want lettuce, tomato and grilled chicken next time (If there is a next time at this point....)   :(  They are not knowledgable, but they are very friendly and the grilled chicken tastes good.

Went here to celebrate my parents' anniversary with a large group of family. We reserved 8 tables in a section of the restaurant and had a dedicated server. The food was served one by one like a numbered course meal, and each dish was fresh. All the food tasted good, and the mango sticky rice dessert was shaped like a heart!  The server was pretty attentive, and we got our refills at good intervals. Free refills on Thai tea!

Indeed, you're correct!  Thai places are a dime a dozen, but Panna may just be what you're craving.  Do you have a hankering for spicy eggplant, wait dumplings did I hear you whisper?!  Something extra spicy aka hellaciously hot is what you wish for- go ahead and let them know when you order:)  Please opt for a fried rice, yes I do always opt for the pineapple fried rice.  Hell, if it's not broke don't fix it! Insert wink emoji here please! I add snow peas into one.  Please note the picture I posted this time around:) Meats are succulent and scallops are always cooked accordingly!   Panna provides one with traditional & distinctive Thai in all levels.  Panna is the spot on place for to devour bowls of curry! So hurry!

Wow!! Ordered delivery. They arrived right on time! Ahi tuna salad was amazing. Crab fried rice was tasty!! Curry chicken fettuccine was genius!! Ive been to plenty of thai restaurants and i was impressed!!

My family and I dined here on Sunday. We arrived around 1pm. Not many people in the restaurant. Just a fair amount. The server that sat us down was not friendly. Didn't greet us, didn't smile and didn't explain the menu. Mind you, this was our first visit. The food was okay. Took a long time to come out and lacked some flavor. Their Thai tea was a whopping $4! Free refills thank god but that's too much for Thai tea in my opinion. The place had a nice ambience and was clean. Would I come pack? I doubt it.

I have been to Panna thai restaurant multiple times. I have tried their duck noodle and pad thai. Very friendly staff and food is very tasty while affordable.   We are already a repeat costumer and it is strongly recommended.
Loved the eggplant and tofu skewers. I would get the sauce on the side next time. looking forward to trying it more
Great atmosphere  Great food Very reasonable pricing  I promise you will be impressed by this Thai restaurant
I've tried many Thai places in Las Vegas, this one is hands down the best.
Just flat out good. Had Pumpkin Curry, very close to my favorite dish at my regular spot in Seattle!

I've been to a few Thai restaurants in Vegas (yeah even Lotus of Siam... Which has great food but the ambiance of a bus depot)... This is hands down our favorite Thai restaurant.  Nice ambiance, great pricing, and the dishes are amazing. I usually stick to the Crab Wantons and Pad Thai but they have a new tapas menu that is insane. Everything we tried was a winner.   Hidden Thai jewel in the southwest. I promise you.

Been here a few times, the staff is friendly and the food is great! Nice decor overall & the free refills on Thai iced tea when dining in are a plus. The Papaya Salad and Pad See-ew are delicious.  Highly recommended!

Value of lunch special was decent--for 6.95 you get your choice of meat, a soup and a small fried won ton.  We had garlic short rib and chicken satay special.  Satay was good, garlic sb ok sauce was a little too strong/salty.  We also ordered pork larb which was good...don't order fried egg rolls as these were frozen and not hand made...I wish I didn't order it.  Restaurant was hot...and there wasn't anyone else as far as patrons.  Service was good and restaurant was clean.  I'd go again but only if in the area...one good thing is lunch ends at 4 where as most places it is 3.  One bad they charge for more rice at 1.50 per bowl.

I've ordered delivery and pick up and service is always polite and fast. Our go to is the ped see ew and curry dishes and they are always delicious! For pick up I was greeted by Apple who was really friendly:) The restaurant looks clean and nicely decorated. I want to try a dine in experience next time and I'm sure we won't be disappointed!

Panna Thai is the sister company of Thai BBQ, which my family and I been coming to since I was a kid!  So knowing that, their menu is pretty similar and the ambiance is great. It's more of a modern twist with Thai vibes.   I celebrated my best friend's birthday here with her family and we ordered a whole bunch of items to share from bbq chicken to pad Thai, salad and fried rice and you can't forget The unlimited refills for Thai Iced Tea, AMAZING!  Definitely a neighborhood friendly spot and great menu to choose from!

Decided to give them another go tonight. I've definitely experienced better, much better, and even from Panna Thai. The wife's pad kee mao didn't have the little corns, tomatoes and was just boring and not well thought out. My green curry with beef had a whopping 3 pieces of eggplant in it and they tried to make up for the lack of the beef's flavor with tons of heat when I asked for medium.  Enough is enough and we won't be going back. There are far too many other options in the area to continue going there for lackluster food.
The food is decent, but with the handful of times I've been there...worst customer service, EVER.
Lunch specials are priced right, however, the meat dishes tend to be overcooked, hard and dry. Will not be returning.

I am so happy to have a good tasting Thai restaurant literally just 2 minutes away from me!!! From my most recent visit here, I got the papaya salad and the beef pad see ew. From my pictures it looks like the portions are small but those two were enough to really fill me up (and I eat a lot). For the papaya salad, I got to choose a spicy level from 1-10 and I got a 6 and it was actually pretty spicy which I appreciate, but my favorite was my pad see ew. The beef was so tender and it was actually thick slices of beef which makes it so much more better. The noodles were not dry, they were perfectly soft. They also have a lunch deal as well so if you just want something small for a good price, ask about it!
One of my favorite Thai food spots in town. I've dined in and ordered out and always had a great experience. The food is authentic & the servings are generous.

Been eating here for years. Great service and great food. The lunch specials are pretty inexpensive and the service is fast. Great place for a lunch break. Always friendly and clean.  Awesome desserts too.

Love LOVE love this place. I've never been to the actual restaurant but have ordered through doordash and this place is fantastic.   We have ordered a few things off the menu, but my favorite is the chicken satay with peanut sauce (it also comes with egg fried rice and cucumber salad) and of course the chicken pad Thai. It has some kick, but not a ton. I def will keep ordering from this place and wanna try out their Thai tea or coffee next.
We've eaten here 3 times now, trying different items, and every meal has been wonderful. Friendly staff, comfortable decor, great service... Highly recommended.

I got carry out of tum yum soup and panang chicken, the tumyum soup was good but the panang chicken was terrible!! The sauce was so runny it seemed like they added a ton of water to the sauce and it had absolutely no taste at all.. I love panang and have gotten it at many thai places and none have had the sauce so runny and watery
I love the chicken curry here. The fried rice is really good too. The place is really nice inside.

My family has been going to Thai BBQ for years & we recently found out this was their sister restaurant so we decided to give it a try!  The server was very accommodating to my bf & I who were the only vegans in the table and helped make our entrees vegan friendly - we got the Spicy Basil Fried Rice (no eggs) with steamed tofu, Pad Thai with fried tofu, a small order of Tom Kha soup with steamed tofu (big enough for the both of us to share) and all were mild spice. I also ordered a Thai iced coffee and my sister ordered a Thai tea which both have non-dairy creamer in it. We loved how it's refillable - just like their Thai BBQ locations!   The food was pretty good and tasted exactly like their counterpart restaurant but none of our dishes had the spice level we asked for. We were really looking for that spicy kick to our food but had to ask for the hot sauce spice rack to add it in ourselves. Heads up that their "mild" is probably considered a 1 or 2, not like your usual mild at a Thai place which is usually at a level of 3 or 4.  My family enjoyed their dishes which included the shrimp Panang penne, pork jerky, BBQ chicken with fried rice, chicken pad Thai, crab fried rice and pork BBQ ribs. The only comment they had was the crab fried rice barely had any crab in it but overall they had a good experience.   Service was good and the restaurant definitely had a fancy ambiance.

Okay we tried this place out because we wanted Thai and went with the least delivery charge among the delivery apps. (We went with grub hub lol) And we've stuck with them ever since!  The fella orders the crispy duck which is heavenly! Very well seasoned, perfect crisp, delicious hoisin sauce and overall truly unforgettable.   I order the crying tiger and OH MY I cry tears of joy every time!! The meat is so tender and flavorful with a sauce that though is quite delightful is not truly needed. However, I do at times use the sauce for my veggies!  It's a great dinner for when you want something delivered that won't ever disappoint!

Excellent food and service. Wish I knew about this place sooner. Started with the egg rolls then ordered the pork BBQ noodle soup. So delicious and a huge portion That I had enough to take home and have for lunch the next day.

This thai place is very good but ordered it too much over a period time.   But recommend it if you live in the area or craving thai. They deliver and the inside of the restaurant is clean and welcoming.  Recommend their chicken panang curry, beef pad thai, shrimp tom yum soup and my absolute favorite their crab cream cheese rangoon's.  If you have a sweet tooth their mango & sticky rice is pretty good and the mango is already sliced in slices for easy eat.
Tried this place for the first time and I absolutely loved it!!! The food was super fresh and prices are reasonable! It's hard to find good Thai Restaurants and this one is on my favorites list!
Their tom yum soup was absolutely fantastic. It had a lot of depth of flavor, and the medium heat packed a punch. The Beef Satay was also very good and rounded out a truly delicious dinner.

It's the 2nd time we ate here. First time we came was based off Yelp reviews and the fact that we just live down the road next to Wet n Wild. My husband and I are vegetarians but not strict enough to worry about fish sauce or similar stuff like that. We mostly just order the food with tofu instead of meat or seafood. This place does it well. Very much comparable to our favourite Thai place which is just a little further from home - Archi's on Rainbow.  The first time we came, I ordered the lunch special - both of us agreed that the soup that came with it was so tasty! I had the Pad Thai and he had the tofu Panang Curry. Both delicious!!  Today we tried the Summer Rolls with peanut sauce!! OMG YUM! Will definitely order it again!

Fairly typical Thai dishes, well done with lots of veggie choices. One of the few thai restaurants that gives you refills of thai iced tea which should be the standard for a $4 drink. Nice atmosphere and friendly service. Hard to quibble with that.
Really good flavor and very light food. We got the pineapple curry fried rice, chicken wings, and sweet & sour chicken. All were very good!

I have been coming to this library cation for 9 1/2 years now and I'm impressed how they keep the food consistently good. I've brought other family members and friends here they can't get enough. My most favorite item from the menu has to be the crab wontons .

I have really enjoyed this place the two times before we went awhile back but recently had a horrible expierence.  Not sure if they hired new folks but they were just rude.  My family and I a total of 6 of us with two little ones went in and the service was super poor.  There was only 2 other people in the restaurant.   When we went to order we just asked to have a chicken breast for my daughter and they said no whole meal...they were so focused on serviing whole plates they couldn't accomadate.  I even told them to charge us the full price but just a chicken breast is what I needed but they said no that they couldn't do it.  We asked for a side of broccoli and carrots and they said no.  It was ridiculous.  At that point I didn't care if they charged me $20 bucks for broccoli that is what we needed but they couldn't do it.  Finally my husband went to talk to the gentleman behind the counter and asked for the manager and he was very rude and said no manager here and there was nothing he could do.  My husband said we would leave so we all got up and went next door to the sushi place where they always treat us great.    The gentleman tried to make excuses saying it wasn't his fault and he didn't serve us and he was busy with the two other people in the restaurant.  They still charged us for food they never brought us and we were so frustrated that we gave them the money and left.  We will never go back ever and I would suggest if you want a stressfree meal not to go as well.
Came here for lunch and got their chicken sate. It was very good. Server and the rest of the staff were sweet.

My husband and I had dinner here this evening and the food items we chose were very good. I had combination fried rice and he had pineapple fried rice and we shared crab won tons.   However, this is where the good experience ends. We waited 45 minutes for fried rice dishes accompanied by less than mediocre service. As we were waiting other guests arrived and walked out from waiting so long. It's a shame because the food quality is excellent and this restaurant could be one of the best.
I love this place! I have almost tried everything on their menu and have loved everything. My favorite is the Chicken Saute. Everyone who works there is great, food is great, and it's clean!

Unfortunately, the quality has gone down. The noodles taste plasticy, dried up chicken, not fresh tasting and juicy at all like used to be. After ordering online through yelp24 well before opening for a 11:20 am pick up, had to wait for 20 minutes for the order which ended up being lukewarm and missing the eggroll for the lunch special.

Great place, friendly atmosphere.  Food was excellent !!  My friends and I were in town and had craving for Thai food, I found this place on Yelp, and we were not disappointed.  Pad Thai & Panang curry is the best I've ever had.  Food was served fresh, delicious and quickly.  Their Tom Kha soup is to die for.., so much flavors.  Service was great, friendly and attentive.  I will definitely go back and I would recommend this place !!

I have been going to Panna since the day they opened. There food taste has been very consistent. They have great lunch specials at affordable prices. The restaurant as a whole is more modern, the decor and the plating. Also the way the dishes are cooked defiantly is unique to this restaurant, they use crushed dried spices and it's usually topped on ever dish I get. I love the shrimp pad Thai, panang curry, and papaya salad.

Came here for lunch 2 days, and was honestly thinking of giving it just 4 stars until the second day when I got the pink noodles.    This place has really good food, I really don't have anything to complain about, but it just wasn't blow my mind status...until I looked at the regular menu and saw the pink noodles.  SO GOOD!!!  It's a bit sweet but at the same time spicy and you can choose what types of noodles: thick flat, thin noodles, or egg noodles, and I got mine with the squid and shrimp, and they didn't skimp on that amount either which was spectacular. I was sooooo happy with my food!!  I also ordered the asparagus and mushrooms, smaller plate but definitely a good size, cooked well and the mushrooms tasted amazing!!  I will probably be back in the area again sometime for work and I am definitely planning on coming back here for some of that awesome food! :)
Clean restaurant and delicious lunch special! Free thai tea if you leave review here on yelp :) yumm!

Just swung in to get some Pad Thai to go. Nice place and still seemed busy after the lunch rush.   My Pad Thai was mediocre. Not bad but I wouldn't order it again. I ordered it "spicy" which equated to "a little bit of heat" in my mind. Take that for what it's worth. Also, my wife says she only gets curries here and they are very good.

Had lunch here with a friend.. The food, service n establishment awesome!! The lunch specials were not only tasty but plated nicely and big portions. Oh and prices are so affordable that I took a second look at the bill when the server gave it to us.  The lunch special selection is so extensive that my friend n I could not decide bc of too many great choices. Well we will be coming back again n again to try everything;)
I needed a spot for a business lunch and saw this spot.  This was a great surprise, food Awesome! Service AWESOME!  I will be back again and again.

I absolutely love this place! A friend recommended that I try it so I stopped by to grab lunch. I was on a rush so I ordered my food to go, but even though I didn't dine in I was still impressed. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and the food was delicious. I would definitely return again!
Thai food can be found all over town but this place has some best I've had in Vegas.  Thai soup is excellent & combination fried rice is awesome.

Sometimes they have good Pad Thai and sometimes they don't.  I hate when a restaurant is inconsistent!!  The service is decent and I like that they deliver when I'm to tired to go out.  The lemon chicken is good.  Haven't tried much else.  It's okay...

When it comes to Thai food I am very picky since I was raised on Thai and Lao food. Panna Thai, you were great! The food was exceptional and authentic to me. I always compare my Thai food to my mothers home cooking and Panna Thai did a great job!

Unbelievable service & food!!  I'm in Vegas for work.  I'm using Uber so I have no car.  ALL other Thai restaurants would not deliver at 9:30pm due to closing at 10pm.  But this place DID without hesitation.  Delicious chicken satay & amazing peanut sauce.  So happy with this restaurant.  I also order the fresh rolls & fried rice.  All super delish.  Absolutely recommend.

This place is great! I have food allergies but love eating out. They always take care of me and keep the "can't haves" away from my food. I love their chicken pad Thai! If I had the money I would eat here everyday! The best part about this place is the fast delivery and you can order online/in app. That's right, I love this place so much I downloaded their app! Lol. We dine in every now and then but with a new baby delivery is just better if the baby is fussy. Great place with great staff. Would (and do) recommend to friends.
The server recommended Crispy Tofu & Eggplant... AMAZING! Curry was also good, but the Tom Ka Soup was PERFECT! Great job Chef
Americanized. Everything is very sweet. Ordered the Pad See-Ew, Tom Yum soup, and the Beef salad. Decent price, although I have to compliment their interior. Very modern and clean.
My sons absolutely love the Sa Te six skewer dinner very spicy and I enjoy the green curry with chicken and spicy basil sliced chicken medium spice perfect

Outline: Very slow service, iffy food.  Ok, I gave it 4 tries. This time it really did it.   I would give three stars for food. Here is why: I don't think it's anything great, but it's not too bad either. Although yesterday my husband refused to finish any of the dishes and my 3 year old is literally throwing up as I write this. Last night he had fried rice and soup (she hadn't eaten anything else for dinner - very slim chance of a coincidence).  All four times I've been there, it takes 40 minutes to an hour + to get done. And we are usually "fast" eaters. We sit down, we know what we want, we eat, and we're out. We go out every day and don't have time to sit around and talk like some people do.  Ok, I can understand that also, but when it takes 10 minutes between asking for a check and actually getting one there is something wrong here. My husband had already left by then as my 3 year old had enough of sitting there that long. Good thing I paid with cash or I wouldn't be able to wait for another 10 minutes for them to run a card.  As much as I want to like it, I can't, and I won't be going back.
Awesome service and food. The chicken at this place is good quality, white breast meat. RAD !
Super friendly, open late (til 10pm), amazing tofu pad Thai, and they cater to vegans. Happy girl! Glad it's so close to home.

I absolutely love this restaurant and I'm always treated wonderfully here. I've been going for several years now and it's definitely my favorite Thai restaurant. One of my favorite things is that you can get the lunch specials with fried rice because most Thai restaurants in Las Vegas will only give you white rice, when you order for just one person.   I love the dishes and some of my favorites are the pad see ew, bbq spare ribs, salmon, beef and chicken skewers. I also highly recommend you try substituting Chinese broccoli instead of regular broccoli on many of the dishes and soups.  Last but not least, the waitresses are so beautiful and friendly.

My husband and I have ordered from here several times and there has NEVER been a issue. The food is excellent and fresh and the delivery service is prompt. We ordered the combo satay, spring rolls and pad thai. Everything was fresh, packaged nicely and delicious. I must recommend the spring rolls especially because of just how well made they were. The satay came with rice and the best peanut sauce I've ever eaten. There literally isn't one negative thing i can say. I highly recommend Panna Thai!
Very nice customer service and delicious food. I wont tell why but you have to come and try it and youll see what im talking about! Trust me it is the best thai restaurant i have ever eaten!

We were celebrating our anniversary on New Years night and thought this restaurant was the perfect spot. I was wrong.   We entered the restaurant with no issue as we were seated right away. And that's when everything went wrong. The waitress took a long while to get our order,  and when we were ready, my girlfriend asked if we can have all our orders delivered at the same time. This is because her main dish was tom kha kai which tends to come in first because they're served as an appetizer. She also ordered pineapple fried rice with that because that's how she enjoys the soup. Back to the order, when she asked the waitress if all our food be delivered at the same time, the rep retorted a not-so-reassuring, "Uhm... I hope so." She chuckled and walked away. Experiencing was displeasing as if they weren't even going to try and make it happen.  We waited a while for our food to come in, and guess what? They all came in separately. First, it was the chicken satay which we ate pretty quickly. Then we got the soup and my noodle entree. My girlfriend tried waiting for the fried rice when she realized that her soup was getting cold. Very displeasing to see her not eat with me. At that point, she started eating the soup and thinking twice about the other order that was still late. So she went up to another server to tell them that she didn't want that order anymore.   The food was very basic. Nothing about it stood in mind. My noodles lacked a little bit of sauce as it appeared dry. The satay was rubbery and the peanut sauce that went along with it was bland. My girlfriend liked her soup but was not impressed about the mushroom used with it. Still, it hit the spot.   Overall, would we come back for a second round? No. The restaurant was courteous enough to give us a 10% off discount for the trouble, which was surprising because it didn't really seem like they cared from the beginning. Anyway, we're too paranoid for repeated offender so I think we'll pass this restaurant and go somewhere else.
